Reviews.Title: “Quiet spot in heart of Fells”
Reviews.Author: julie b
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect spot to stay when meeting friends out in Fells. We live just around the harbor but wanted to be able to walk back and rest in piece (sans enfants). Shelby greeted us and was very helpful and engaging despite the other events going on in the lobby. Too bad we couldn't stay longer to enjoy the breakfast or cocktail hour. Next time...

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Would've Loved to Stay Longer”
Reviews.Author: MsCasualTravelor
Reviews.Content: Stayed her efor a business trip, at the advise of the company I was meeting with. Fantastic stay: comfy bed, lovely room, more than suitable bath. Very historic, lovely setting. Beautiful water view. Continental breakfast was plentiful and delicious (tons of variety in th efruits served). ...and the complimentary bottle of wine at check-in was a pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Debbie K
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with others in stating that this hotel is really great. We were greeted at the front desk by Raymond Hart with a welcoming bottle of wine for the room. He upgraded us to a garden view room at no charge. Brett Henry, the manager, was an extremely gracious host at the complementary cocktail hour. He conversed with the guests, and made sure their drinks were filled and hors d'oeuvres were available. He offered us several great suggestions for dinner reservations. Our room was nicely decorated, very clean, and the bed was really comfortable. Parking was free, and we were able to keep our car there for the day after we had checked out which simplified our sightseeing plans. The hotel has a free shuttle to the Inner Harbor, and George, the shuttle driver, was extremely helpful as well. All in all it was just a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: MoMo_24_24
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a perfect location in Fell's Point, a great room and continental breakfast but the best part was the service. The staff, especially Mr. Raymond Hart, were extremely friendly, helpful and accommodating and made you feel like they truly cared about your stay. They offer a shuttle service to Inner Harbor and we bought tickets at the hotel for the Aquarium and got to avoid the long lines and timed entrance. I would recommend this hotel 100%.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Goucher College”
Reviews.Author: danchel465
Reviews.Content: Henderson's Wharf is a wonderful location, right on the water. We had a view of the harbor from our window. The room was extremely nice, the staff helpful. We got a bottle of wine for the room on arrival, a cocktail hour with hors d'oeuvres, free parking and a very nice buffet breakfast. It was also in easy walking distance to the restaurants and shops of Fells Point.

Reviews.Title: “Truly the best place to stay in Baltimore.”
Reviews.Author: petra h
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at this hotel for at least 15yrs. It is always clean ,the staff is awesome and always friendly. It's location is ideal. Right on the harbor and parking is free if you stay. The breakfast they offer has a great selection and the fruit is always fresh. They treat us like family and we would not stay anywhere else. Infact some of their staff, past and present we consider friends. Do yourself a favor book a stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “cozy, quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelen4l
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went here for a getaway weekend, and we were very happy with our choice of hotel. The hotel is located right on the waterfront in Fells Point, away from the center of all the loud taverns, but close enough to be able to walk easily. The reception desk gentleman was very friendly upon checking in and offered us our complimentary bottle of wine, a wonderful added bonus of staying here along with the free parking, can't beat it! We found the room to be very comfortable and clean. We also took advantage of the free shuttle service and found the driver to be very professional and friendly. The front desk staff assisted us with dining reservations and setting up for the driver to get us there and back, can't ask for more! We also enjoyed the complimentary breakfast and found it to be very satisfying with excellent fruits and breads. I will definitely recommend this hotel to my friends, and totally agree with it being rated #1 on trip advisor!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in the heart of historic Fells Point”
Reviews.Author: Richard H
Reviews.Content: What a surprise. Our room was spacious and elegant. It's a renovated tobacco warehouse, right on the water with an adjacent marina. It has a rustic but urban feel to it. Personnel were very pleasant and helpful. The hotel is located right in Fells Point, within easy walking distance to several bars, pubs, restaurants, shops, small theatres, etc. Great night life. A great location when visiting Baltimore. Easy to get to. I'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, somewhat pricey, hotel, in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Sutter
Reviews.Content: This smallish "boutique" hotel, part of a small chain, occupies the first floor of a harbor-side condominium building. We first reserved a "marina-view room," but upon checking in discovered that while we could see the marina at an angle fro our window, the room was really on the front entranceway (there were also street-side rooms). When we complained, the receptionist quickly put is in a pricier "harbor-view" room at no extra cost. The room was comfortable, and the bathroom modern and large. In-room Wi-Fi was fine, though if one wanted to use the "business center" PC off the lobby, they would discover that the computer was out of service and had been for at least a couple of days (an error message saying a virus proteciton was out of date appeared on the screen). One staf member said they didn't know that they were going to do with the computer. Maybe call a tech? Two other small "problems": -the room look out on a public walkway that goes along a long stretch of the harbor, so you need to be aware that you may have people walking outside your room at almost any time. -the card entry machines use to activate the gate to the parking area (apparently no attendant on duty, but there was barbed wire on the fence where there wasn't water) were built far enough from the entryway that it was very awkward to position one's car to be close enough to use one's room key for the machine and also be able to drive through the gate without hitting a post. The machine at the entrance to the lot sometimes would not work during rain. Maintenance! The Thursday night reception had few people the night we were there, even though it featured decent snacks and wine. This was in February, not high season. A decent Continental breakfast is included. There is no restaurant for dinner, but there are several places within easy walking distance. The hotel gives coupons good for discount at some pricier eateries, such as Ruth's Chris. The free shuttle bus can take you to several places, but you need to be sure when it's on a set schedule and when it's on-call. During the set schedule periods you may have a long wait for the next run. All in all, a peaceful place to stay, and close enough to attractions to be convenient. It isn't cheap (we paid about $200 with tax), but you can pay more at several upscale chain hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, warm and most enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: BBesq
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the inn for only one night, but had a wonderful time. The blistering cold outdoors was heartily offset by the warm welcome inside. The rooms were well-decorated with an inviting, rustic undertone, yet clean and up-to-date. The Sunday brunch was hearty and good, but not overly elaborate or particularly unique. Paula was helpful and a laugh-and-a-half. Not to be forgotten is George, the nice and very knowledgeable shuttle bus driver. He practically (at our request) served as a quasi-tour guide, pointing out various locations of interest and teaching us about Baltimore's history. Overall, we had a very nice time and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Another fantastic stay at Henderson Wharf”
Reviews.Author: lovesylvie
Reviews.Content: This is about the 6th year that my friend and I have stayed here for the Baltimore ACC show.. This is one of my favorite hotels ever..... Cute neighborhood, so close to downtown but very quiet yet in a neighborhood that does have restaurants and shops close by. Great continetnal breakfast, helpful staff....... I love love this place!

Reviews.Title: “A Valentines day treat for my girlfriend!”
Reviews.Author: densters
Reviews.Content: This is the second year I brought my girlfriend here as a nice quiet treat for Valentines day. The entire staff is very helpful and nice. The complimentary bottle of wine ,free parking , very nice continental breakfast and the closeness of the Fells Point shops and restaurants makes it just what I am looking for .The rooms themselves are tastefully appointed and very clean. We had an issue with the "destination fee" as check-out but the manager worked with us. All in all,A great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Inn in the Charming City”
Reviews.Author: Ydubby
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before leaving on a cruise and glad we did. Just beautiful! Its an old refurbished warehouse with the Inn on the first floor and condos above. You could almost imagine what this was like "back in the day" with the cobbled streets and harbor right outside.We usually stay closer to Inner Harbor but decided to try this place in Fells Point. It was very convenient to walk to all the shops and restaurants in the area( John Stevens Pub at the end of the block had excellent crab cakes). The Inn provided free parking, a delicious free breakfast and free bottle of wine. The cost was a little higher but with the freebies it balanced out with a much nicer room. Exposed brick, handsome woodwork with plantation shutters, and elegant decor, Just great! Staff was helpful and well informed about the area.We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, and the BEST staff”
Reviews.Author: smrtcookie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located within a short walk of the awesome Fells Point area. The room itself was beautiful with the exposed brick wall, upscale touches everywhere - marble, designer tiling, etc. When we got back from dinner we found our tv wasn't working - normally we don't care but it was the night of the dog show we were looking forward to watching it...and they gave us a new room without any problems. The front desk staff was so friendly and always helpful. The breakfast in the morning was perfect as well, but there are also great restaurants nearby like the Blue Moon Cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Waterfront hotel with B&B personality”
Reviews.Author: Susan B
Reviews.Content: Henderson's Wharf Inn acts like a hotel with a B&B personality. Exposed brick walls, stately arched windows with waterfront or courtyard views, comfortable accommodations, and an attentive staff all contribute to the classy yet non-stuffy atmosphere. Parking is included, but you don't need a car to explore all the quaintness of Fells Point. All other Baltimore attractions are only a short drive. We were fortunate enough to have a corner room with water views from two sides. As long as you don't mind the foot traffic passing by your windows as joggers, dog walkers, and others stroll along the boardwalk on the water sides of the building, I would recommend booking a water front room. As an added bonus, the continental breakfast provided is healthy and generous. You can't go wrong with this hotel! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: Kriskaz
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel Perfect location Free secure parking Comfy rooms Amazing staff Only place to stay in Baltimore

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, hip location”
Reviews.Author: jag343
Reviews.Content: Small hotel in a great location -- right on the water in Fell's Point. Quiet, but a very short walk to the vibrant bar and restaurant scene. Occupies the 1st floor of an old wharf warehouse, with condos on top. My room was quite; bed soft and comfortable. Service friendly. Rust on iron stained my pants, gave it to the front desk in the morning and they had it ready for me that evening. Fitness center has about 8 machines (running, elliptical, bicycling) and a bunch of nautilus and was always empty when I was there. Great continental breakfast with lots of fruit; oatmeal; bagels; croissants; cereals and juices. Coffee 24 hours, plus some in your room. And as others mentioned, they hand you a bottle of wine at check-in, even asking red or white and what varietal you prefer. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Classy quaint”
Reviews.Author: Barbara H
Reviews.Content: This is definitely a great place to stay! You are greeted by a small, friendly staff with a bottle of wine and directed to nicely furnished, roomy accomondations. It is extremely quaint and comfortable not in an old or stuffy way but in a fresh, clean, comfy couch way. The staff is helpful and knowledgeable about activities in the area, including tips on restaurants and bars. Paula directed us to a local bar for Sunday specials on a great bloody mary. Definitely take advantage of the shuttle service, then there is really no need to drive during your stay as everything is conveniently located. TIP : No need to opt for valet parking, as the lot is just a few steps away.

Reviews.Title: “You'll like this hotel - no doubt.”
Reviews.Author: Matty D
Reviews.Content: The location is awesome: at the end of Fell Street right on the water. This is secluded just enough to give it that quiet peacefulness from the shops and bars which are only a 3 minute walk down Fell Street - and you definitely have lots of places to choose from in Fells. The Henderson's Wharf is the only hotel that I could find in this area that had complimentary parking which is in a lot right next door. When you add in the fact that they greet you with complimentary wine, put out an excellent breakfast spread, have really comfortable beds in nice big rooms and have a friendly staff on hand, you're bound to enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, wonderful ambience”
Reviews.Author: William S
Reviews.Content: Waterfront location on a cobble stone street in walking distance to fine restaurants and not far from the Inner Harbor area -- I look forward to staying at Henderson's Wharf Inn everytime I come to Baltimore. The staff have always been great; they know my name, they know the best restaurants in the area, and there has never been a busy line of people trying to get their attention. The breakfast buffet is a bonus, especially when I have a have a choice to sit alone or to sit at a real diningroom table and share a few moments with people I've never met.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended - for the right price!”
Reviews.Author: PlecWriter
Reviews.Content: Due to my need to be proximate to Johns Hopkins Hospital, I was recently (Jan 2012) forced to spend 9 consecutive days in Baltimore (this is not something which I would do willfully) and I lodged at a number of different properties during this protracted stay. Without question, Henderson's was the nicest of these hotels. The positives include good beds, clean tight sheets (a rarity), plantation shutters on the windows, endless TV channels, respectful staff, a location (+free parking) which is just outside of the normal Baltimore craziness and a limited but workable continental breakfast. There were a few peculiarities which I couldn't quite understand - cheapo papier toilette (why?), a noisy heating system (banging and clanking) and a couple of pillows on the bed which could have been used on a camping trip and a non-functional iPod alarm clock dock. Management was totally responsive to my concerns and adjusted my costs accordingly. Overall, quite good and be sure to step out for a walk on the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.Very nice value.”
Reviews.Author: Mare1208
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel by the water in a quiet and very charming part of town. Greeted with a complimentary bottle of wine and, included a nice continental breakfast with lots of fresh fruit. The room was at street level and very quiet. Tasteful furnishings coupled with a brick wall with shuttered windows added to the rooms' charm. We would definitely make it back again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: kateD746
Reviews.Content: This place far exceeded our expectations! The location is perfect, walking distance to the center of Fell's Point but in a quieter spot. The building is on the water, get the harbor view to see the sailboats. The room is beautiful, spacious, and so comfortable. Breakfast was perfect, tons of fresh fruit and baked goods, and coffee and tea are available all day! The front desk helped us make a dinner reservation and even arranged the shuttle to take us! It was just perfect, we have told friends to go and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca C
Reviews.Content: Outstanding Property! My husband's birthday is New Year's Eve and I wanted to treat him to something special, so started looking around at places in Baltimore. I called Pier 5, part of the Harbor Magic Group, but was told they had a two night minimum. The operator immediately suggested their sister properties in Fells Point and after hearing the description of Henderson's Wharf, I was sold. Upon arrival, the hotel attendant wished my husband a "Happy Birthday", information which was obviously passed on to her from the first operator I spoke with. Very nice personal touch, he was impressed! We had a beautiful harbor view room and this beautiful, romantic hotel could not have been more conveniently located to our favorite places in Fells Point and neighborhoods close by. We walked to Little Italy for dinner and Inner Harbor for fireworks and ended up back in Fells Point for a nightcap just a few steps from our hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and well located”
Reviews.Author: ABarrosTx
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at the Inn @ Henderson's Wharf. High points are its location (near all Fell's Point attractions) facing the waterfront. The lobby is spacious, there is a nice garden, staff is helpful. You get a complimentary bottle of wine on arrival. Our room was comfortable, equipped with a small fridge, coffee-maker, iron+iron board, huge TV with hundreds of channels (the remote is a bit naughty, though). The bathroom is well designed, the cosmetics available are good quality. Wifi is free and fast enough. The décor is classic, cozy, without excesses. The room is quiet, and the air conditioning is comfortable, adjustable and silent. Breakfast is simple, but very tasty, including a good selection of fruits. The only complaints relate to relatively few tables for breakfast (in summer, having breakfast in the garden must be great) and the difficulty in getting a taxi to arrive at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Henderson's Wharf highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: pk_14_12
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation on-lineat Henderson's Wharf for my husband's birthday in October but were disappointed that no harbor view rooms were available. Along with our confirmation was a note from a gentleman named Bryce saying to contact him if we needed anything (e.g. show tickets, restaurant reservations, etc.) I sent Bryce an email and asked if it would be at all possible to get a harborview room (perhaps wait listed for a cancellation?) and I received an email the next day from Bryce stating that he had upgraded us to a water view! I can't say that this could happen for everyone that requested it, but I was thrilled. Our room was immaculate, the view was fabulous, the breakfast was plentiful with something for everyone and the staff was very accommodating. Outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: abow75
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here three times and lived every stay. We always stay in a water front king. The view is amazing...just stepsnaway from the harbor. The price is reasonable, especially considering the beautiful room and view. This is not your "standard" hotel room. We love to explore the Fels point area sonthe location can't be beat. Also, management has always been helpful and worked very hard to accomodate us!

Reviews.Title: “Location Makes Up for the Small Flaws”
Reviews.Author: clh6262
Reviews.Content: I am very surprised that this is the number one rated hotel in Baltimore on Tripadvisor. That being said, I did enjoy staying here because it was comfortable and very close to everything you would want to do. Rooms are equipped with nice amenities, coffee maker, fridge (with one bottle of free water - the other one is $5, so watch out,) hair dryer, one robe, satellite tv, free wi-fi, iHome, and desk. The furnishings are pretty enough (stained carpet - but that'll happen anywhere.) The management seemed friendly enough and I had the impression that they would help us with anything we needed. They did arrange transportation (only $45) from the airport for me and responded to my e-mails instantly - big help. There is also free parking. The small flaws are that the cleaning crew did not really clean or replenish the coffee supplies and there is a small privacy issue with the first floor rooms. (All the rooms are on the first floor, by the way.) I highly recommend getting a "Garden View" room if that's a problem for you. Our t.v. didn't work - but it was fixed immediately. There's so much to do in Fells Point, there's really no need for a functioning t.v. - just f.y.i. I would stay here again but I must tell you that this is not a luxury hotel just in case you got that impression from its rating. There's no bar or restaurant or doorman. No one is going to carry your bags for you. The location, however, is such that you probably don't need those things. And luxury prices don't mean a better experience. I give it a "thumbs up."

Reviews.Title: “Added Bonus”
Reviews.Author: t3reid
Reviews.Content: We had a fine stay at here, and only wanted to add that the Baltimore Waterfront Promenade runs alongside the Inn, This seven mile walkway hugs the waterfront from beyond Fells Point to and around the Inner Harbor. If you have a first floor room with a harbor view, you' notice joggers going by your window: they're taking advantage of the promenade. It's wonderful for a lovely walk.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: tulipg17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our wedding night in July 2011. The room was sparkling clean, spacious, and the water view outside our window was lovely. We had a free bottle of wine and bottled water and the included breakfast buffet was more than enough for the two of us. My husband loaded up on the different choices and brought it to me for some breakfast in bed- it was simple yet perfect. I particualrly like the fact that the hotel has a private (free) parking lot and also that the staff was very friendly and accommodating to everything my husband needed when he checked in earlier in the day. I live in Baltimore but if I ever needed a hotel for any reason in my city again I would look forward to coming back. If you are in town to visit you'll find the location optimal.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Henderson's Wharf Inn!”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the Inn at Henderson's Wharf. The room, location, food, and unique design made for an incredible stay! We would like to thank Shelby who checked us in for her professional and pleasant demeanor. We will definitely do it again!

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving at the Inn”
Reviews.Author: Lobsterroll704
Reviews.Content: My daughter was hosting family Thanksgiving at her home in Canton, so this was a great location. We got a corner room, which meant that we could open the blinds and look at the water from two sides of our room. Beautiful! I loved walking along the water, the proximity to Fells Point, the very comfortable big reading chair, the friendly staff, and the bottle of wine that we were given when we arrived. I would stay in a garden view room if my visit was in the spring and summer--I might feel a little exposed in the waterfront room if there were more people out strolling.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate Service, Ambience and Location”
Reviews.Author: Lynne B
Reviews.Content: I booked rooms for myself and my two brothers as we headed south for a sad family occasion. After traveling all day from Boston, we were greeted by Raymond at the reservation desk as though we were family members returning home. During our two day stay, we were treated with the utmost professionalism and warmth by the staff. I have traveled extensively for business and experienced the "breakfasts" provided by many well known chain hotels. The breakfast at Henderson's Wharf Inn is exceptional in the quality of its offerings -- the fruit was at the peak of ripeness and the coffees fantastic (and available most hours of the day). The Inn's location is perfect for walking along the waterfront and exploring the excellent restaurants that are in the neighborhood. And, in the event you want to visit other parts of Baltimore, the water taxi is just down the street. I'm planning to visit friends in in the Baltimore-Washington area during the winter months and will definitely use Henderson's Wharf Inn as my base of operation.

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxful atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: BeverlyMA
Reviews.Content: We stay at Henderson Wharf on our way to Florida for the winter. It is our treat to ourselves. it is always a peaceful retreat and we have always been treated fantastically. One year we left Boston at 3AM to beat a snowstorm, got to the hotel at 10AM, asked if we could use the lot to park in until our check in time and was told we could check in then and please help yourself to the breakfast buffet. Service is just great and the rooms are always clean and well supplied. A nice bottle of wine to welcome you , and a soft bed. Only complaint were the pillows--little too big. No problem for me, as I bring my own special pillow (neck problems) but my husband did complain about having a sore neck. Otherwise, we love it and always recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cherrypt
Reviews.Content: Perfect Location; Quiet; Understated; Not a typical corporate lodging experience. Tremendous value!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in Fells Point on the water”
Reviews.Author: rejoyceWashington_DC
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend at the Henderson Wharf Inn located in the Fells Point section of Baltimore. I had a great time. Its directly on the water and has a boardwalk that stretches almost all the way down to the Inner Harbor. The hotel is in a great spot within easy walking distance of the restaurants and bars of Fells Point. Room felt very "homey" and comfortable. Friendly staff. 2 drawbacks, no bell staff to help with baggage and bad pillows. Otherwise it was great. Definitely get tickets for the Aquarium at the hotel and save yourself a lot of time and money.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tula_Toronto
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Henderson's Wharf Inn the night prior to a cruise trip. The Inn was in a great old part of Baltimore, lots of cobble stone streets and some nice shopping around the hotel. The staff were extremely friendly and helped me to book a train trip into DC for the afternoon for some sightseeing. The room was cozy in a good way - soft carpeting, a big bed with nice sheets. (They also connected me with a limo driver to take me from the hotel to the cruise terminal the next day - this was a good thing because I was becoming a bit frustrated with the taxi drivers in Baltimore who refused to turn their rate meters on.) I liked the feel of this place - and how helpful and friendly the staff were. As a single woman traveller, I felt safe and comfortable. Breakfast was good and there were lots of choices.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places to stay in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: LMMB3420
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice place to stay in Baltimore. The staff is courteous and the property is well appointed and clean. The breakfast was good, but not outstanding. It was more than adequate for us. We loved the fact that we were in Fells Point and could walk to many places from the hotel to get dinner or enjoy a drink. I would recommend Henderson's Wharf to anyone and would stay there again when in the area.l

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: Matthew K
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel full of character and extremely friendly staff. From the moment of check-in to check-out all of the employees we interacted with were very helpful and always smiling. Check-in was smooth, parking was very convenient, and the room had everything you could need - wine glasses, complementary water, a coffee pot that made 12 cups, iPod dock, even q-tips and cotton balls! Fantastic location and a gorgeous sunrise over the harbor made for a perfect stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Way better than any of the commercial hotels”
Reviews.Author: lmezo
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at one of the commercial hotels on the Inner Harbor but after reading the rave reviews on Trip Advisor, decided to try something different. Great decision. Beautifully decorated, comfortable rooms with personalized service overlooking the docks in a tranquil, picturesque part of the city. We parked our car in their private lot (included in the cost of the room) & didn't use it the entire weekend thanks to their shuttle service to the harbor & everything else conveniently located within walking distance. Given a bottle of wine at check-in - nice touch. Also included was a delicious continental breakfast including juice, coffee, tea, large variety of fresh fruit, bagels & cream cheese, sweet breads & muffins, cereal, yogurt & hard boiled eggs. The only negative was the TV - nice big flat screen with satellite service - but a real challenge to get on & off. Definitely the best experience we've ever had in the many years we've been visiting Baltimore. We'll definitely be back & recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly quiet great location”
Reviews.Author: Ssc3201
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff went above and beyond for us during the marathon last weekend. They found a friendly Baltimore police woman who would actually let us cross the race route in our car. Otherwise we would have been trapped.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding small hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: PeteVa
Reviews.Content: Although we know Baltimore well, this was a special experience from making the reservation to check-in though breakfast the next morning. All the staff was very attentive and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean freak meet clean freak!”
Reviews.Author: Rhodestraveled
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a wedding around Baltimore in May. Did a lot of research ahead of time and decided on Henderson's Wharf. Really enjoyed our stay. One of the best continental breakfasts I have ever had at a hotel. If you prefer not to dine in common areas their are trays to bring back to your room (nice touch for those non morning people like me). They also provide you with a complementary bottle if wine at check in too. Rooms and hotel were nicely kept. The room reminds you of an open industrial loft sans high ceiling. When unpacking I thought I saw something under the bed what I found was a card from the staff saying thank you for looking under here yup we clean here too! Lol in all my years if traveling! They will definitely get another visit from this clean freak. Lol. Other pluses good location, safe and close on site parking. Minuses bathroom was starting to show some wear and was a little small(room was big) and the overall cost seemed a bit high. However, would go back in a heart beat if back in town.

Reviews.Title: “believe the reviews”
Reviews.Author: class7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Henderson's Wharf this Sept 2011, and the reviews on how great this hotel is, are accurate . The clean comfortable room, decour and staff where excellent and the location was part of a superb stay in Baltimore. They have a shuttle service and many other features at not only their hotel but also their sister hotels.(Admiral Inn and Pier 5 )We had a great holiday in Baltimore and highly recommend this hotel to other travelers. Thanks andrew

Reviews.Title: “one of the best luxury value hotels I have been in”
Reviews.Author: Paranormalnj
Reviews.Content: i was only there for one night, but the room was fantastic, comfortable, luxurious, beautiful and with a comfortable bed! Check inn was a little late (4pm) and we paid extra for a harbor view that was marginal at. Best, but I have no real complaints. I have stayed in more expensive higher profile hotels and spent twice as much for less. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem of a hotel on the Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: DougSBear
Reviews.Content: what a treat to find this 34 room property - great check in and front desk staff, clean well furnished rooms, including complimentary Voss water and a nice european style continental breakfast in the morning. Free parking in a secured lot. They offer both harbor views and garden views - we had garden view and sat in the garden to have our breakfast Sunday morning - easy walking to the destinations, free shuttle and discount tickets and VIP service for reservations, etc. After one stay, we're fans and will stay here again. Avoid the chains and stay here the next time you go to Baltimore

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: dovewood
Reviews.Content: We had the corner room facing the marina which had to be the best of the best. There was even a door right next to our room that allowed us to go out on the wharf to see all the sail boats. Loved it !! The breakfast was full of fresh fruit and what seemed like homemade muffins. One of our favorites had to be having fresh blue crab on the wharf only several miles from Henderson Inn. Let me caution you that on your way to Henderson's Wharf Inn, the section of town is not the best and made us concerned. Once you are at the Inn, everything seems to change and the place is exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: bfvach
Reviews.Content: Will come again in spite of a couple of small things... We requested a room close to the lobby as walking is a problem, but that request was ignored and we had to wait over a half hour for another room. The TV did not work well and the remote was broken. Someone came and played w the TV, got it to work on one channel but it was annoying to have to get up to shut it after dozing off. Never got our complimentary wine either. All in all though, a nice place and as I said, we would give them another try.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Evening At Henderson's Wharf Inn”
Reviews.Author: BobHorn_StPete
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have never been to Baltimore before, so when we needed a place to stay for one night recently, I turned to online reviews, including those here at TripAdvisor. We chose Henderson's Wharf Inn based on location and reviews. We were not disappointed. Everything about this place is first-rate, from the 'feel' of the place to the staff at check-in to the beautiful flower-filled courtyard that we walked by on the way to our room and, finally, to our room itself. Spacious and comfortable, impeccably clean. And the bed was, bar none, the most comfortable bed we've experienced in any vacation scenario. Five stars and our wholehearted endorsement for Henderson's!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome inn! We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: MardiGras7
Reviews.Content: Beautiful waterfront property, it just doesn't get any better than this! So close to shopping and great restaurants. A little pricey, but isn't everything these days? We loved it and we'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Always Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Linda E
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Inn each year and every visit is great. This year was no exception. Staff members really care about your comfort and work hard to make your stay memorable. With the addition of the guest cocktail reception, shuttle and access to the fitness center, the benefits are even better! The rooms are beautiful and special mention needs to be made of hotel managers Brett and Tara for going out of their way to make sure everything was taken care of. As always, a wonderful visit!

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as the reviews suggest”
Reviews.Author: wiseoleman
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on Tripadvisor we expected better.When we arrived by auto we pulled up in front of the main entrance.I walked to the front desk and inquired about a bellhop.The guy behind the desk looked at me as if I was crazy.He pointed me to a luggage cart ,which being a senior was not easily pushed thru a long lobby to our room.The room was well furnished,but for $200+/night you would expect a king sized bed.My next complaint was that the A/C made a loud noise,odd for a cental A/C system.The desk clerk said the noise would diminish,which it didn't.As for the supposedly wonderful continental breakfast,it was a few servings of fresh berries above one that you can find at a typical Comfort Inn.It's sad that this place is the best Baltimore has to offer!!!

Reviews.Title: “Change of Ownership changed the atmosphere of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: ne1410stoday
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in this hotel - the location is lovely, offers free parking and a nice breakfast buffet. But in the time between my two stays (December and August), the new ownership instituted several changes, which, to this patron, were not for the better. My reservations were made about a month in advance, and I specified two beds for two guests (my daughter and me). The only room that was available upon my arrival was a king bed, and there was only one bathrobe. There is a "destination charge" of $9.99 levied on top of the other charges. This was not disclosed prior to my arrival. Supposedly, this charge covers the extra amenities being offered - a shuttle service and regular hotel "events" (each weekday offers a different activity), neither of which were necessary or desired by my daughter and myself. There is a coffee and tea setup for guests throughout the day. Unfortunately, at 8 pm, there was no hot water available. The hotel staff are very welcoming and helpful, so any requests were quickly satisfied, but after asking for a packet of hot chocolate, it was disappointing to have to return to ask for the hot water to be replenished. The buffet breakfast that is provided is ample - there are cut up fruits, juices, baked goods, yogurt, and hard boiled eggs. The buffet table is kept well stocked and everything is replenished. The room seemed noisier than the previous stay - not because of other guests, more like the hum of machines turning on and off during the night. Unchanged was the feeling the rooms were not adequately lit.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: rjejr
Reviews.Content: What a nice surprise! We were looking for an inexpensive place to stay for a night while we delivered our daughter to college. The price was remarkable for the amenities offered. A very nice continental breakfast was included. We awoke to the usual newspaper, but a handy tote bag was on our doorknob, which made packing up that much easier. The location on the waterfront made for a delightful evening's walk. And there was no charge for parking our car. All in all, this was high value stay at a very cute Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the Reviews”
Reviews.Author: PhilliesFan097
Reviews.Content: Everything about Henderson's Wharf Inn is interesting and attractive. It is an intimate boutique hotel with beautiful rooms located in a very quiet residential/restaurant/shopping district right on the water. All the rooms are on the first floor and have views of the harbor,marina or courtyard. The hotel is well within walking distance to the busier sections of the inner harbor but also provides a shuttle service for your convenience. The staff know the city well and Raymond and the assistant manager each provided us with excellent dining choices (Melle's and La Scala). At a sister hotel, Pier 5, Jimmy told us about a fantastic breakfast place that was featured on Diners, Drive ins and Dives, called "Blue Moon Cafe" (a must for breakfast). Also, Bonaparte's bakery and coffee shop is on the same block as Henderson's and is terrific. We loved it all. One thing, though, the dish network TV service lost signal a good bit as did the internet service...didn't matter to us but it may to you. The management at this place is so on top of things that it'll likely be fixed before long.

Reviews.Title: “Henderson's helped to make my hubby's birthday perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: anointedlady_11
Reviews.Content: I am still smiling!! This is truly a place that I know we will come back and visit again and again!! I agree, Raymond at the front desk was awesome; he loves his work, he enjoys people, and his pleasant attitude and helpfulness was wonderful!! In fact, everyone behind the desk were wonderful, and you don't find that at many places. The atmosphere of the Inn has a welcoming quality to it, and makes you not want to leave. Our welcoming bottle of wine was a lovely touch (we chose the white wine, which was delicious, cold and ready for pouring!) At first, after reading the reviews of being on the first floor, I didn't think it would be a good view of the water/ships, but I was mistaken; it is all right there for you to enjoy!! There are joggers that run by the window (as mentioned in previous posts), but during our visit, we had rain off and on, so there weren't a lot of them. After having dinner at a wonderful restaurant, we came back, and had a nice, quiet time sitting on a bench right by the water; no mosquitoes, no humidity, just a delightful breeze to enjoy ... After a while, we went indoors to the lobby and relaxed in the lobby's comfortable couches, then retired to our room for the night. A quiet location, away from the noise and activities of the area, and I really liked that. Breakfast was delicious!! Yes, they have the orange juice in a ceramic pitcher to pour, there were bagels, toast, all kinds of fresh fruit, and the coffee was fresh and hot! There are trays available to take our food back to our room (almost like a breakfast in bed setting!) We are already talking about our next visit at Henderson's; to the staff at Henderson's, I thank you for making my husband's birthday very special and memorable; you are the best!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful! I will be back.”
Reviews.Author: nadine732
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely time at this hotel. My room was absolutely beautiful and so very comfortable and cozy. One of the nicest hotels I've stayed in, my favorite. The staff was wonderful. Thank you for such a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Everybody loves Raymond!”
Reviews.Author: Dave V
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived on a Monday evening with no reservation because we found ourselves enjoying Baltimore so much to the time we left after a great breakfast on Tuesday morning, we were treated like preferred guests. The first person to greet us was Raymond. He was professional, polite, and accommodating. We had a beautiful room with a fantastic view and when I was unable to figure out the remote control, who showed up? Yup, Raymond to the rescue! Our short stay could not have been better. Give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “World Class boutique”
Reviews.Author: EAM1950
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently including around the world, this hotel ranks with the finest I have stayed in, boutique style, not a cookie cuter, every amenity that matters, clean, friendly, quite, conveniently located. This is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Relaxing Spot in Fells Point”
Reviews.Author: SusanCBM
Reviews.Content: Came down from PA for a relaxing night and found it at Henderson's Wharf. It was a great place to stay and wander the Fells Point area. Our room was beautiful, extremely spacious and had a great view. The lobby was great and breakfast the next morning was wonderful. Sat in the courtyard and enjoyed a cool morning with coffee and croissants. We were given a complimentary bottle of wine upon arrival - which I thought was very nice. Only wish that we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: chrishan05
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me by taking me to Henderson's Wharf Inn for my Birthday this past weekend. It was a lovely experience from start to finish. The Inn had an amazing calmness about it - we felt so comfortable while in and around the property. The room selected for us was perfect; spacious, clean, and tastefully decorated. The large windows opened to a nice harbor view. Our bed was unbelievably comfortable and helped make our stay even more relaxing. We enjoyed our breakfast buffet meals while sitting in the quiet courtyard. The staff members were pleasant and helpful. Fell's Point was great. The hotel is in an excellent location - close to the restaurants, pubs, and water taxi (all within walking distance) but off on it's own quiet stretch. We look forward to our return. The Henderson's Wharf Inn tops our list of favorite places to stay!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot”
Reviews.Author: johnflair14
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoy Baltimore and especially Fells Point as one of our favorite little vacation getaway spots and on our most recent trip we decided to check out Henderson's Wharf Inn. It was such a great experience and now I know I don't have to be checking out different hotels on my future trips it will simply be a return trip to Henderson's Wharf. The service was top notch and all members of the staff were so were so very gracious, rooms were great, breakfast in the morning was such a treat, and the location you simply can't beat. I was so very pleased with our most recent experience and stay in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BEM124
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location on a quiet wharf near all the Fell's Point action. If you like to be able to walk to restaurants and bars, then this is the place for you. The staff was very accommodating and polite. The room was nicely decorated in what I'd call clubby-urban decor -- exposed brick, large, masculine furniture. Very clean. We looked out on the central courtyard, which was quiet and lovely. It would be a nice place to sit and sip the complimentary wine. Downsides: We didn't find the bed particularly comfortable and breakfast did not live up to the reviews (it was a fine continental breakfast, but I was expecting something delicious). They also put a ~$10 charge on our bill for internet. We had not been forewarned that there was a charge for the internet. The hotel did take off the charge when we complained.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: PasadenaMom0710
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed just one night at Henderson's Wharf to celebrate our anniversary. Even though it was the hottest day of the summer (105F), our room and the lobby were deliciously cool. Every staff member we met was friendly and outgoing. They circulated around the lobby to chat with every guest during the complementary happy hour and breakfast the next day. Free parking available from before check-in to well after check-out was a plus. The only suggestion I could make was that even though we weren't there to watch TV, the screen could have been a little bigger. I have since been told that larger TV's are being ordered for all the guest rooms. Plenty of places to eat and festive night life just a short walk away. Convenient water taxi to the Inner Harbor and other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Just do not think it should be rated so highly...”
Reviews.Author: DBS17
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in April for the second time, and I do hope to return if we somehow travel to Baltimore. I don't have any major issue with the hotel, but also feel strongly that It shouldn't be rated as one of the top hotels in Baltimore. We just had too many small things that seemed inappropriate, from not being able to control the room temperature, to needing to reset their TV after a storm, to having laundry carts trundle through the breakfast area 8 times. The rooms are very nice and comfortable, and the location on the inner harbor is very interesting, especially with the boats that can take you around. I don't have any experience with the other hotels, I just find it hard to believe this is one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, really helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: disneyfan407
Reviews.Content: Great view from our room of the harbor. Walking distance to restaurants and shops. Great Japanese restaurant around the corner. Short water taxi to aquarium. Great spot, very quiet. The only thing that would have made it perfect was a pool at the inn. They did offer a free pass to a gym 7 blocks away from the hotel with a few pools.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel to stay at”
Reviews.Author: Wheelman73
Reviews.Content: The Henderson's Wharf Inn was absolutely wonderful. The hotel staff were extremely friendly, especially Ray the frontdesk clerk. The hotel sits right on the harbor and the views are very nice! The hotel room was very inviting, roomy, and I can not rave about the comfort of the beds. Most comfortable beds I have slept in. The harbor view was also nice to wake up and sit and have a cup of coffee. The continental breakfast -exceptional. There was fresh fruit, watermelon, honeydew, cranberries, rasberries to name a few. To many nice items to list, but was by far the best continental breakfast I had. The hotel also is close to inner harbor, however just far away enough to really enjoy PEACE AND QUIET!!. Well worth the money, and time to stay here. We look forward to returning very soon!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! They offer a shuttle service for $9 a day per room. Another bonus in my book they took us basically anywhere and everywhere within the inner harbor. Cant beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: UKUK-Traveller
Reviews.Content: As ever Trip Advisor is my Bible when travelling and this time it did not disappoint! Hendersons Wharf was just such a lovely hotel, the rooms were beautifully decorated, the location at Fells Point was perfect and the staff were very accommodating. We especially enjoyed and would thoroughly recommend the Food Tour which was based around the Fells Point area. All in all we Brits loved our stay in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “A little off.”
Reviews.Author: lrs-ljs
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times . I requested a spacific room a week or so before check in. I was told they would try. I have done this before and been accomodated. This time there was a touch of indifference. And I did not get the room that I requested. I noticed that the mini bars are gone along with flowers in the bathroom. Just little things like that. The rates are not any less, but things are just a little off. Hope this was just an anomoly and not a trend of things to come. This has been a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best weekend get-away ever!”
Reviews.Author: MW1218
Reviews.Content: Inn at Henderson's Wharf was the perfect place for our July 4th weekend get-away! First, the hotel has the best location in the city... in Fell's Point. It is close enough to everything by foot, cab or water taxi, BUT it is tucked away on the waterfront and is quiet and private. AND, there is free, secure parking right next to the hotel. The lobby is gorgeous. The room was big, comfortable, and beautifully decorated. The continental breakfast in the lobby made it feel like we were staying at an intimate B&B. And the cold bottled water left in the room for us was a perfect treat after an afternoon out in the heat. I travel a lot, and have stayed at other properties in Baltimore. This is the best in town...

Reviews.Title: “Awful Stay. Will never return.”
Reviews.Author: rmaryann
Reviews.Content: June 26th-June 28th. We have stayed at this hotel every time we have come to Baltimore. It has always been a great getaway, and we always look forward to our stay there. Our last stay was awful. The Front Desk girl that was there was very hospitable. We arrived 5 hours before check in time, and she still found us a room right away. She was very kind, and always willing to help out with whatever we needed. She made us dinner reservations, and even brought our bottle of wine to our room. The housekeeping staff could not understand a word that we said... and we had left things on the dresser and in the bathroom when we went out for the day and everything was moved around when we came back. It took me a few minutes to find my lotion that I had left out. We did not have the room type that we wanted. It said we had a Harbor View room, and when we arrived, our reservation said Garden View. The Front Desk agent apologized profusely and she changed it back to what we originally reserved. Upon check out, I asked for the hotel managers card, so I could call him and explain my concerns. I left a message on his voice mail the next day, and I still have not heard back. I did not want to resort to putting this on here... but seeing as no one has contacted me, I feel it is my last resort. It is a shame that we had a bad experience. I hope to maybe return one day in the future, and have it be like it was every other stay besides the last.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: padcrasher
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Henderson's Wharf Inn and we definitely enjoyed our stay. The room was spacious, the beds were very comfortable, but the room could have had more light. We kept our shades closed because our room was on the ground level (as are all the rooms) and we did not want walker/runners along the pier peering into our room. But, our view from the room of the harbor was lovely. Service: There could be more front desk staff. During our stay, it seemed like the young lady working the front desk was extremely busy and she was the only person at the front desk working until the next morning. Inspite of this, she provided great service. The bottle of wine upon check-in is a nice touch. Food: the continental breakfast was fantastic and was one of my favorite aspects of the hotel. The continental breakfast offered nice variety and the fool was delicious. The woman who tended to the breakfast was friendly and efficient; she provided great service. Value: Truly, the only issue I had with the hotel was the price. It's an expensive hotel for what one receives. My wife and I have been fortunate to travel and stay in some great hotels worldwide and it seems in our travels; we have experienced more for what we paid for at other hotels than what we paid for at the Henderson's Wharf Inn. The Henderson's Wharf Inn is a nice hotel and I will recommend it, but it could add something more.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: light89
Reviews.Content: For having to go to Hopkins due to a life-threatening illness... I couldn't have chose a nicer place to stay... The staff, impeccable, the service even better... The room I stayed in during my visit was VERY nice!! It was the garden view with a queen-size bed. The bed was sooo comfortable, especially for someone that just had an intense surgery at Johns Hopkins, which I might add is the best hospital in the world... Everyone there made me feel at ease, and considering the traumatic experience at Hopkins, I was extremely comfortable. Lee at the Front Desk was especially accommodating... She even helped me get through the entrance at check-in... I honestly can't think of a nicer place to stay. Their amenities leave absolutely nothing to be desired... Free parking, free internet, a complimentary, Continental breakfast in the morning, free wine, a newspaper every morning, not to mention the lovely location. I've been to Baltimore before, and I was expecting a city grit feeling while I was there. Henderson's Wharf was a God-send.. It was so quiet there, and I actually got a chance to enjoy their courtyard which was quite beautiful even though at the time it was a bit cold! I have never stayed anywhere that I felt so at home. The staff were so genuinely pleasant, and after staying there I definitely would not stay anywhere else! I'm happy to say that I'm healing quite nicely after the ordeal, and although I hope I'll never have to go back to Hopkins for obvious reasons, I would stay at Henderson's in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “The Most Romantic Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: RitKei
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my Birthday weekend. We had room #109 (a corner room) and it was absolutely fabulous! Very quiet, peaceful and the BEST continental breakfast we ever had! The fresh strawberries were huge and delicious! The front desk staff was courteous and professional and acted very pleased to have us. The bars/nightlife/restaurants are just a block away...nice walk and safe too. Will go back very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Problems Here”
Reviews.Author: wakefantwo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to Baltimore several times a year. This time we decided to splurge and try Henderson's Wharf Inn. The price of the room with tax was over $300 for a "cobblestone view" (think street) but it had gotten good reviews so we decided to go for it. The room was nice but you had to keep the blinds shut to keep passersby from looking in. This made it seem rather cave like. Our next surprise came when we returned from a late dinner to find that the TV control did not work. After a long wait--the sign said the desk clerk was away helping other customers who I guess were having problems as well--the clerk returned. She came to the room but couldn't fix the problem so we were stuck with CNBC all night. The next morning we awoke to discover there was only one bath robe in the closet, not enough bath towels for the both of us and a coffee maker but only decaf coffee. In desperation, I got dressed and trooped down to the continental breakfast area to get some coffee. It turned out to be barely warm. We complained to the desk clerk when we checked out but she said there was nothing she could do. Only the manager could help us and he was out of town for two days. I asked to have the manager call. That was almost a week ago. I am not holding my breath.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: TByrom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Baltimore to visit Gettysburg and see a baseball game at Camden Yards. The hotel was convenient to the freeway, and the water taxi to downtown was a treat. We were surprised by the beauty of Baltimore's inner harbor, and we would have missed it had we stayed closer to downtown. The hotel staff were wonderful, and the room was large and inexpensive. Parking was free and nearby. The continental breakfast (included in the price) was excellent. The surrounding area of Fells Point is interesting, plus it offered many and varied opportunities for dining. We enjoyed our stay and would return.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: lisadworkin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at Henderson's Wharf frequently since our son was studying at Johns Hopkins. We've stayed in many luxury hotels, and Henderson's Wharf compares favorably with all of them at a fraction of the price. The rooms are luxurious, comfortable, and spotless. The staff is friendly. The location on the harbor is great. The free continental breakfast is much better than the typical free breakfast. Plus, internet access and parking are free. This is almost unheard of at a hotel of this quality. I can't recommend Henderson's Wharf enough.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: PPB_Tony
Reviews.Content: Came to see two Yankee games at Camden Yards. Nice hotel with continental breakfast included that would be much nicer if they had more than three tables in which to sit and eat. Had to take food and drink back to room. A complimentary bottle of wine at check-in is a nice touch. Everything about the room is top notch. Very close to bars and restaurants of Fell's Point. Would stay again if I could get a better rate.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: philaexperiment
Reviews.Content: We loved it here!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The most amazing beautiful room, wonderful front desk hotel workers and best of all wonderful breakfast. This is one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in. The location is amazing, about a 5-10 minute drive from the aquarium. I can not say enough about the Henderson's Warf Inn. We hope to come back very soon!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Inn, Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: grmm3
Reviews.Content: We booked two nights at the Henderson's Wharf Inn based on many fine reviews on Trip Advsor. We were not disappointed. The place really lives up to its reputation as far as accommodations and location and amenities. It surpassed our expectations as far as staff and service. All our contacts with the Inn before and during our stay were exceptional for their friendliness and warmth. The people who work at Henderson's truly make you feel welcome and truly seem to enjoy being friendly and helpful. Particular thanks to Nathan and Lieszl, who facilitated our change of room on a fully booked time period---we requested a stay for one night in the only available harborview room which necessitated a change to a cobblestone view room the second night. Both rooms were large and comfortable and nicely furnished. The Inn has a very convenient locked lot in which to park right at the circular entrance to the Inn---the parking is included in the room rate or free depending on how you look at it. The continental breakfast also included was exceptional for its variety and presentation. The Henderson Wharf Inn is truly one of the most friendly and comfortable places we have stayed. It is a Baltimore gem and deserving of all the great reviews on Trip Advisor. The Inn is also located in Fells Point, much quieter than the adjacent Inner Harbor area, and only three short blocks along the waterfront to the water taxi, which provides unique transportation to all the landings and sites and museums in the Inner Harbor area. After a day spent in the Inner Harbor and adjacent areas, it was great to literally escape back to the quaint and quiet Fells Point, which was, however, not without its many shops and great little pubs and restaurants. We have recommended the Inn to many of our friends, and we look forward to our next visit to Baltimore and Henderson's

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Stay without a 5 Star price!”
Reviews.Author: CDM928
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here the night of our wedding before heading out to the Dominican Republic for our honey moon. When we arrived we were surprised mainly because the price we paid was not nearly comparable to how nice the Hotel was or its elegance. From the moment we entered we felt that we made a good choice. Our room was very comfortable and inside was a whole plate of fruit and cheese as well as a bottle of wine and two glasses (I'm guessing they did this because they new we were honey mooners but its possible they do it for everyone). A perfect gift for two newly weds who hardly got to eat at their own wedding reception. The hotel is located in a great place in order to walk and experience the historic district of Fells Point which is also located on the water. Over all we were very encouraged by our stay and have suggested the hotel to our friends since.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fabulous Stay!”
Reviews.Author: raykabia
Reviews.Content: My Anniversary stay at Hendersons Wharf was simply fabulous! Hendersons provided the perfect combination of Classic and Modern. Any weekend away from the kids and the business of life is great, but this was more. A bottle of wine to celebrate seven years of wedded bliss, A tasty complimentary breakfast, A quick walk around the corner to the bakery to get a yummy croissant at midnight and peace and quiet were all the reasons we would recommend Henderson's Wharf for an in town get away or for the out of towner looking for great accommodations. Go, Stay and Enjoy! :-)

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay at Henderson's Wharf!”
Reviews.Author: Jaelm_11
Reviews.Content: I have traveled many places and I have stayed in a lot of hotels but Henderson's Wharf is one of the best. My husband and I stayed there and had the best time. The staff was courteous, friendly and knowledgeable. When we checked in we asked where we could go for drinks and dinner and we were given plenty of choices within walking distance. The location of the hotel is perfect. It is close to all the action but tucked back facing the harbor where it is quiet and peaceful with a beautiful view. The lobby is very pretty and wraps around an outdoor area with a beautiful garden and sitting area. The room was large and clean with a great big comfy bed. The bathroom had plenty of space with nice plush robes and towels. The view of the marina was so pretty and close I felt like I was on a boat! If we didn't have plans that night I would have loved to just lounge in the room and watch the boats in the harbor. My husband and I plan to go back when we don't have plans so we can just enjoy Henderson's Wharf and Fell's Point! I highly recommend this hotel and I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Best Experience Ever at a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DoctorWu2
Reviews.Content: First time staying at Henderson's, and I was not disappointed. The front desk were very pleasant and accomodating, providing me with useful info for my stay, making sure I knew about the free continental breakfast and complimentary bottle of wine. The room could not have been any nicer, the bed was comfortable, it was immaculate with all I needed for my stay. I would stay there again and highly recommend it to anyone wanting to stay in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful stay at Henderson's Wharf!”
Reviews.Author: Adotdot
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Henderson's Wharf for his Birthday in February and it was the most wonderful stay. The service and the hotel were impeccable. We were greeted by a professional and polished staff, who couldn't have been more helpful. We inquired about a good restaurant and we were given several options. When we chose Damimo's, a great restaurant in nearby Little Italy, Lee, at the front desk, arranged for reservations and a private towncar to pick us up RIGHT AT THE DOOR! After checking in, we went to our beautiful, clean and private room. We shared our complimentary bottle of wine and got ready for our dinner. The hotel is in the perfect location. After the towncar dropped us off back at the Inn, we were able to walk to all the hot spots in Fell's Point. It was a pleasure to be able to go out and relax without having to worry about driving or finding a cab. The next morning we went to the beautiful garden inspired lobby for their continental buffet. I was expecting a typical muffin and coffee breakfast that is the norm for a "continental" breakfast but there were fresh fruits, cheeses, all kinds of breads, hard boiled eggs... I could go on and on! Overall, our stay was delightful, comfortable and lavish! I would reccomend The Inn at Henderson's Wharf to anyone. If you are looking for a place to stay in Baltimore, this is the BEST!

Reviews.Title: “NOT HAPPY WITH OUR STAY, EVEN THOUGH SOME POSITIVES”
Reviews.Author: Adventures96
Reviews.Content: Hello...Let me first say that my wife and I are very open minded and hardly ever complain about anything, even if things aren't to are liking. However, we were very disappointed in some of the things during our stay at Henderson's Wharf on April 1st, mainly with service. We arrived on April 1st, the day before our cruise vacation. We paid over $250 for an Inner Harbor room with a harbor view. I booked this room several months in advance and were promised a room on the highest floor possible, facing the water/harbor after requesting this. We were also supposed to get a bottle of wine with our reservation upon arrival. We we arrived we were checked in very hastily by a young man, then given the keys to our room. We never did receive the bottle of wine or anything else. However, we did notice other people receiving wine. We went to our room, but instead of being on the upper floor as requested and promised, it was Room 123 on the first floor. Well, in this room you could hardly see anything of the harbor, or any water. What I did see was iron fence and railings and a lot of joggers running past my window all the time. The room itself was nice, but the carpet in this room had that musty, terrible smell and was worn. Not sure how the other rooms were. The breakfast was good. So, I guess for what we paid, we were expecting some things promised that we never received. I know, you will say, why didn't you ask for your bottle of wine and ask to be switched to another room. Can't answer that. Just figured roll with the flow. I would still suggest this hotel, but would hope this lack of concern for us would just be an isolated incident. Everyone else seems to be happy. i guess we had to be the first to get some employees who forgot some things.

Reviews.Title: “One of my new favorites”
Reviews.Author: Michelle Anne
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about this Inn. It is now one of my favorite places to visit. Everyone we came in contact with was pleasant. Loved the room and furnishings, comfortable bed and nice bedding. Room and bathroom were very clean. Really nice continental breakfast with lots of good choices. Nice touch to offer the bottle of wine at check in. Everything was perfect. Appreciated the free parking. As stated many times, great location and you can walk everywhere or take the water taxi which is close. We were fortunate to have a nice spring weekend and also enjoyed sitting in the garden/courtyard where you can eat your breakfast in nice weather. It shows that they take great measures to think of everything to make it a wondeful experience to stay there. I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it used to be.”
Reviews.Author: ChappaquaNY
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Inn at least 1/2 dozen times in the past year and I'm sad to report that my experience of it has fallen with each visit. This Inn is in a lovely location, within walking distance to all historic Fells Points attractions. Non-management employees are nice people; some have a clue as to what's going on while others are unable to answer most questions. The hotel has a preferred guest program that used to offer special rates to members. This program now is nominal, with no offers others than those listed offered. Why have a Preferred Guest program then? Prices of rooms have also steadily increased. The breakfast option is nice. Several cold selections of cereals and pastries. The gym is small and has a very low ceiling, making running on a treadmill for anyone over 5'5" an interesting proposition. If you can get a room for 139., as I once did (rates are now 229.), go ahead. Be forewarned, however, that, while attractice, the lower price rooms are petite.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and charming.”
Reviews.Author: Kitsilano
Reviews.Content: Situated within feet of the water and with walking distance of restaurants, this hotel is one we would return to. Parking is handy; breakfast is more than we could ask for; staff are welcoming. If opting for a harbour view room - a good choice - ask for one above the ground floor unless you like to feel you're virtually on the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Schneid3599
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough great things about Henderson Wharf Inn right in the heart of the beautiful Fells Point section of Baltimore. I have fallen in love with Fells Point with its many unique bars, restaurants and shops, its quaint cobblestone streets and its wonderful and friendly residents. The Henderson Wharf Inn is a perfect match for Fells Point as its far enough away to be away from all of the noise and hub-bub of the bars but only a short walk to be right smack in the middle of all the fascinating night life. The hotel itself is gorgeous and situated right on the harbor for spectacular views and panoramas especially thru the door sized windows. The two large queen sized beds are extremely comfortable and you even get a complimentary bottle of wine to put in your ample sized fridge upon arrival. The service was professional and courteous especially our hostess/manager Lee. The parking is free and so is the succulent continental breakfast that offers only the freshest fruits, bagels and coffee. All of this at a very reasonable price for everything you get. My only qualm about writing this review is I don't want everyone flocking here because I want to have the Inn whenever I want it and I plan on making several more trips to this pearl in the middle of the diamond that is Fells Point!

Reviews.Title: “Bloom is off this Rose.”
Reviews.Author: LeonardBethesda_MD
Reviews.Content: Our first visit a year ago was mind blowing - great facilities and wonderful breakfast but, as important, friendly, attentive and caring staff who couldn't do enough to assist. What a difference his time -- totally uncaring and unresponsive front desk staff. On my wife's arrival at reception while I was unloading, she found the clerk chatting on the phone and giving her no recognition. When I arrived some minutes later, the same scenario persisted -- not even a nod or look to acknowledge our presence. I finally retreated to the business center to check my E-mail. When we finally were accepted for check-in. I was told to park the car on the other side of the traffic circle, but it was full, and I recollected that an adjacent wharf parking was available. I waited while my wife returned to the desk and we were only then told to use our room pass key to open the gate to the parking area, something we should have been told initially. Subsequently, we made a few other routine requests but the response was uniformly rather brusque and not as helpful as it could have been. Repeated efforts during out stay to telephone the desk from the room resulted in no answer. Another's guest effort to have the E-mail printer made operative was ignored and he was left waiting at the computer (which I also wanted to use). When I inquired of the desk what was up, the response was "we can't fix it" and mine was "why don't you just tell him". On our next trip to Baltimore, we will look for other options. What a shame, particularly as good management could have prevented this deterioration in service and could bring it back to where it was if there only was a will. What a shame to what previously was such a gem and great find and great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful find! Lovely hotel in a great location - even in the winter!”
Reviews.Author: chrisandkit
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for an overnight getaway in the Baltimore area to celebrate our birthdays and came across Henderson's Wharf on Trip Advisor. We could not have been happier that we listened to everyone's advice - we loved it! The hotel is within walking distance (if you're up for it) of the aquarium, shopping, the inner harbor, and numerous restaurants/pubs. It is also only a short cab ride if you prefer to all of these locations (round trip to our dinner at Fleming's Steakhouse and Wine Bar, which was fabulous by the way, was only $10 plus tip). We enjoyed a complimentary bottle of wine at check in (red or white - your choice of numerous varieties). The rooms are beautifully decorated and spacious with big wooden shutters overlooking the harbor. We also headed out for a run the next morning all around the inner harbor - even at about 35-40 degrees, it was lovely and a wonderful way to begin our day! Don't miss this hotel if Baltimore is your destination. It was very reasonably priced for the time of year and the value it provided.

Reviews.Title: “Lived Up to Its Deserved Reputation”
Reviews.Author: camerajim
Reviews.Content: We chose Henderson's for an anniversary weekend getaway because of its reputation and it delivered. A couple of friends joining us for dinner arrived early and told the staff we were celebrating our anniversary, so we got a free upgrade on our room and wound up with a harbor view. During our stay, the staff could not have been more helpful nor the hotel more comfortable. We felt so much at home we even went to breakfast one morning in slippers. Speaking of that, for a continental breakfast, the selection was excellent, with a wide choice of fresh fruits, pastries, artisan breads and more. The location is great nor only for the water-level view (all hotel rooms are on the first floor), but also for encouraging short strolls around the Fells Point area. With warmer weather, we would have ventured further on foot, but having the car parked in the secure lot next door was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marinesgirl71
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazingg for being such a great price. My boyfriend and I spent a romantic night here celebrating our anniversary. The hotel staff were very polite and friendly. There was a separate parking lot that required a room key to get into, which made us feel very secure. The hotel had a very charming location, being on a cobblestone road and located right on the water. The decorating at the hotel was beautiful and it had a great atmosphere. The rooms were adorable and had so much character. The bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept on. The view from our room was delightful looking right out onto the water. The stay came with a complimentary bottle of wine which was excellent. The continental breakfast had a great variety. We both enjoyed our stay very much so, and would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: aljones98
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent a weekend in Baltimore and stayed at Henderson's Wharf Inn. The hotel itself (including the guest rooms and common areas) is lovely -- clean, comfortable, tastefully decorated. The staff was friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the continental breakfast each morning; the variety and quality of the food and beverages were great (and the quantity of items was not overwhelming). The Fells Point area of Baltimore, where the hotel is located, is perfect for spending a leisurely weekend. Within walking distance of the hotel were numerous shops and restaurants, including Bonaparte Breads which quickly became one of our favorite stops of the weekend. We took advantage of the hotel's free parking, but never once used the car while we were there, since there was so much to do and see so close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: timnanna1974
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Henderson's Wharf Inn for 2 nights. What an amazing place to stay. The hotel is incredibly charming and the service was amazing.
