A good continental breakfast every day and a bottle of wine at check in. The location is very good as well as many restaurants and bars/pubs are in walking distance in Fells Point. The only thing I would change is the bath tub, which was more like the type of thing you would see at a Holiday Inn than this type of place. Otherwise, the room and hotel was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Very charming and cozy.”
Reviews.Author: kasArlington_Va
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Henderson's Wharf for one night, just to get away and relax. The Inn is really, really pretty, is in a great location, and has a lot of character. We were in room 109, which is, I think, one of the best rooms. It's rather private because it's at the very end of the hall, and it's on a corner so you actually have two harbor views; windows on two different walls. Those two walls were completely brick, with floor-to-ceiling windows with dark wooden shutters. Really pretty. (Note: there is no patio or exit from the room onto the pier; the windows don't open.) Other pros: --room was very spacious, as was the bathroom --furniture was high quality and unique --bed was extremely comfortable --robes were nicer than usual --continental breakfast was really good--raspberries, blueberries, strawberries, melon, little croissants, cereal, V8, juices, milk, bagels, marmalades, granola, hard boiled eggs, etc. --location: you can walk to a ton of restaurants, bars, and shops in Fells Point, plus short water taxi to inner harbor --24 hour coffee, hot tea, hot chocolate --free parking --a ton of TV channels --free bottle of wine Cons (minor overall): --people walk by your windows constantly. The pier directly outside the windows is public, so there are lots of walkers and runners passing by. We didn't have a big problem with this. It's very easy to close the blinds and forget about it. But when you want to enjoy the view or the sun, it can be frustrating. --the shower pressure was really weak --the shower was very dim (the bathroom light didn't extend to the shower) Overall, we were really pleased. We definitely plan to go back. It's romantic and cozy.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler58277
Reviews.Content: The Inn was a treasure in every way. Beautiful room, wonderful location and the breakfast was over the top. Fells Point was a great walking experience and the restaurants were wonderful. The Inn offers so many perks..... on-site free parking, pet friendly, and the most beautiful setting!

Reviews.Title: “WHY?”
Reviews.Author: MARYMS
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location, with one major exception! We made reservations for 2 nights in a garden-view room. Upon arrival, we paid extra for a waterfront view (I don't call it an upgrade when you have to pay). Around 9 pm the first night, a letter was slipped under our door, saying we would have to move to a garden-view room in the morning, as the front desk clerk made a mistake, our room was booked for the following night. We reluctantly moved across the hall, and were compensated for the second night with a discount, but the original room was not occupied the second night, and there were several other empty waterfront rooms as well. Our question is WHY?

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with bonuses!”
Reviews.Author: Aligator224
Reviews.Content: What can I say? I looooved staying here. The hotel is in a great location- right in the inner harbor, right on the water. Free parking right across the street. The inside of the hotel was gorgeous... brick walls, wood shutters, and spotlessly clean with a very comfortable bed and big TV. We were upgraded to a water view room on the first floor- view of the boardwalk and boats. Cute courtyard with seating to enjoy the free bottle of wine they provide for you. Very friendly, helpful staff. Fresh, free continental breakfast. Many sights very close by, with restaurants within walking distance. Next time I'm in Baltimore, this is where I'm staying!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for a getaway!”
Reviews.Author: xenonian
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 days and could not have been happier! The location on Baltimore Harbor was beautiful...we had a room that looked over the harbor and found it peaceful and relaxing at night and invigorating in the morning, It is in walking distance to an incredible selection of pubs, fine restaurants and some interesting little shops. If you want to get into Inner Harbor you can catch a water taxi up the block from the hotel , or if you have your car you are in Inner Harbor in 5 minutes. The rooms were beautiful and they did a great job of retaining some of the old factory brick architecture along the outer walls. Staff is responsive and knowledgeable about the area. Their breakfast buffet was just right with fresh fruits, breads, pastries, juices cereals and coffee (coffee available in the lobby 24/7). They have free parking in a secure lot, wifi and a workout room. All in all - some place to seriously consider! They offered us a nice wine upon checkin as well !

Reviews.Title: “Enjoying some alone time”
Reviews.Author: TIsaA
Reviews.Content: I have visited Henderson's Inn with my daughters before and it only seems to get better. I recently took my other half with me for some alone time to Baltimore. I wouldn't even dream of staying anywhere else. He was really impressed from the moment we stepped out of the car. Everyone is very friendly, the room was spotless, and the location cannot be beat. We always had something to do in Fells Point. We also relaxed on the very comfortable beds. I have and will keep expressing what a great place Henderson Inn is.

Reviews.Title: “A Better Alternative to the Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelerofNJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Henderson's Wharf for one night while on business in mid-August. Have stayed there in the past - 6 years ago. Place still looks and feels the same. Staff very hospitable, courteous and helpful - especially when it comes to nearby restaurant suggestions. Stayed in a garden-view king room - furnishings were comfortable and in good shape. Bed and bed linens were very comfortable. Bathroom had high end amenities and a nice rainfall type showerhead. Nice continental breakfast - plenty of fruits, pastries, bagels, hard boiled eggs, juice and coffee. Self-serve on china. Missing - a little shop for snacks/drinks, newspapers, etc. Walking around the area to find such items is at least a 30 minute commitment. Very quiet inn - not certain it would be good for a young family as the children would have little to do and would probably be heard throughout the inn. Mostly older guests as far as I could see during breakfast. Easy walk to the main street w/ restaurants and the water taxi. Would most definitely stay again alone or with spouse, but not with my young children.

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: CornflakeGirl80
Reviews.Content: Great quiet hotel near Baltimore. The staff was very nice and the area of Fell's Point was great. Very quiet compared to the inner harbor, yet only a short drive or water taxi trip to all of the sites. We were able to sight see during the day, and walk around Fell's Point and get dinner at night. The hotel itself is super quiet and staff was very pleasant. Rooms were clean, yet a tad small compared to toher hotels we have stayed at. Continental breakfast was simple but very nice and staff was continually keeping food areas cleaned up.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing bad to say! Great stay and would stay again in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: aostrows
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel and the service was outstanding! The hotel offered so many little details that many other hotels do not. Free parking was great, bottle of wine upon check-in was also a great perk! The room was large and the bed very comfortable. Location was great and cabs were readily available if needed but there were many restaurants/bars within close walking distance. It was easy to get on the internet and we had a nice view of the harbor. GREAT hotel choice! I've already recommended it to all friends I've talked to looking to stay in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “4th of July delight”
Reviews.Author: mizzoutraveler
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at Henderson's Wharf Inn was a 4th of July delight. The inn's cozy home like atmosphere & it's location right by the harbor allowed for a very relaxing holiday. The surrounding neighborhood is a charming historic area with brick streets & a change of pace from the busy inner harbor area. We had a wonderful view of the fireworks show by walking just outside the hotel to the boardwalk area. Our double queen room had a nice harbor view. The room was tastefully decorated in a classic style with poster beds, an amoire/tv cabinet, & elegant writing desk. The bathroom was large & well stocked with towels & toiletries. A brick accent wall, live plants, & harbor themed artwork added to the room's charm. The only minor obstacle we encountered in the room was with the satellite tv. We found it difficult to operate & slow to connect to the selected station. The breakfast was ample with plenty of variety including cereals, breads, yogurts, cheese, & beverages. Trays are available for guests to enjoy the meal in a beautiful outdoor courtyard, tables in the dining area or in your room. The staff that checked up in/out were courteous & efficient as well.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel with great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Mom016
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with large rooms and a very nice breakfast. Interesting area where you can walk to restaurants. Note that if you want to see the inner harbor (museums, etc.) you need to take a water taxi, but that is part of the fun. I highly recommend this inn. They did not give us our "free wine upon arrival" but that was fine. The only downside as others mentioned is early in the morning you may hear joggers running past your window. Nevertheless, I would highly recommend the inn and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: AJMMSC
Reviews.Content: I'm somewhat a very picky traveler when it comes to hotels. Based on reviews on Trip Advisor, decided to stay for 2 nights June 25-26, 2010 with Loyola University bound daughter. Based on availability we were going to have to change rooms for the 2nd night, however, the hotel accommodated us prior to our arrival to a harbor view room. This was the most amazing boutique hotel which I've stayed in. The beds were extremely comfortable, the view incredible and the morning breakfast excellent. Will definitely stay here again over the next four years. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Yes it is worth it!!!”
Reviews.Author: jaxx1019
Reviews.Content: We went here because of the tips from tripadvisor. Loved this quiet boutique hotel. Beds,towels, pillows so comfy. A little off the beaten track, but worth the walk to ferry. Close to all the bars. Service awesome. Continental breakfast great and just enough. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Low key and wonderful”
Reviews.Author: daddo
Reviews.Content: By all means opt for a harbor-view room with its wonderful decor and ambiance. This hidden gem has it all right - pleasant staff, delightful rooms and superb breakfast. Take advantage of the garden seating if the weather permits. Free, secure parking.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything!”
Reviews.Author: tobique
Reviews.Content: Based on other reviews, we stayed here for two nights. We found everything great and an amazing value. The room was spacious and clean and the bathroom was very large and supplied with plenty of toiletries and towels. One reviewer complained that there is no privacy because the rooms are on a boardwalk, but I walked each morning and it was impossible to see anything unless you stopped and pressed your nose against the window to look through the shutters. I loved being able to see the marina and the parade of people and dogs passing by. The continental breakfast was massive and filled with what I would consider much more than a continental breakfast. It included many fresh fruits, bread, bagels, muffins and danish, cereal, yogurt etc. Lovely. The location is really great too. Fells Point is a nice neighborhood with lots of restaurants, but without the crowded tourist nature of the Inner Harbour. The hotel is a5-10 min. walk from the water taxi so you can leave your car and just walk and ride the taxi around the harbour for your sightseeing. We were delighted with the hotel and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Another amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: fairmountpa
Reviews.Content: Last year, my husband and I came to Henderson's Wharf the day after our wedding. We loved it! Usually, I am not one to return to the same place again. However, my husband and I had such a wonderful experience that we decided to return to celebrate our one year anniversary. Again, we found the rooms clean and comfortable, the staff helpful and cheerful, and the breakfast filled with delicious choices. In addition, the location cannot be beat! I will continue to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, beautiful hotel - anything but ordinary!”
Reviews.Author: SeaPuppies
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights and loved the hotel. We liked the location at the tip of Fells Point and waking up to the water and boats outside our window in the morning. The hotel rooms were large, very comfortable and very clean. The expanded continental breakfast was great - lots of fresh fruit and a lovely courtyard to sit in and enjoy a quiet breakfast. The hotel staff was very friendly and eager to assist with any request. My husband and I enjoyed being so close to the restaurants nearby which enabled us to go for a night cap after returning from the Inner Harbor. Leave your car and wal the few blocks to the water taxi and take it into the Inner Harbor, great water views of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Establishment!”
Reviews.Author: SouthernBelle069
Reviews.Content: My daughter and her husband, travelled with my husband and me to attend her graduation at Johns Hopkins. The Inn was a cross between a great B&B and a small Inn. It actually was the best of both. The rooms were very large, the harbor view lovely...especially with the complimentay bottle of wine upon check-in! Everything was within a 5 mile radius...a perfect location. Very, very memorable. They know how to do it right. The value was exceptional as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Waterfront Weekend”
Reviews.Author: rxchamp
Reviews.Content: Spent the most fabulous weekend at Henderson's Wharf Inn. From beginning to end, just an amazing stay. So many wonderful touches made this visit outstanding, from the complimentary bottle of wine , and the huge continental breakfast offerings. Great location in Fells Point region of Baltimore, lots to do in the immediate area.

Reviews.Title: “All-around great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Essie83
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight as part of my husband's 50th birthday celebration. Perfect location to walk to the pubs/taverns on Thames St. Staff were very professional and helpful. Assumed that the complimentary wine choices would be "red or white?" but was pleasantly surprised to be presented with a selection of three reds and three whites from which to choose. Chose the chardonnay and it turned out to be a very nice wine. Breakfast was plentiful; if you are a "bacon and eggs" breakfast eater, this buffet won't satisfy you (although there were cold hardboiled eggs). This was more in line with breakfast buffets I have seen in Europe (pastries/croissant, bagels, loads of fresh fruit, cheeses, cereals (hot and cold), etc.) You can almost certainly find something you like and it was fresh and beautifully presented. A few minor problems with the room (i.e., a burned out bulb in one sconce in the bathroom, rattling duct work/heating vent that light sleepers could find annoying) but nothing major. The front desk clerk took note of the minor problems upon checkout (I'm sure if I had complained they'd have tried to fix the problems immediately). All in all, a very pleasant stay and we plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to meet”
Reviews.Author: George03
Reviews.Content: Baltimore is a great place for us to meet with old neighbors. Henderson's Wharf is perfect for us. We've been here before and hope that we can keep returning. Beyond a very comfortable room, there is space for us to relax and catch up with our friends from long ago. Nearby are very good local restaurants - try Jack's Bistro. After a good nights rest there is a breakfast (included) that is sure to please everyone. We also appreciate the secure parking. When you consider everything that is included at Henderson's, it is a good value. Until next time............

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: hitherejimbo
Reviews.Content: Last year when I learned that I would be visiting Baltimore - a city I had f not been in for many decades - I did intensive research on places to stay. Trip Advisor rated the Inn at Henderson's Wharf the number one hotel in the city and the comments of guests were universally favorable so I decided to stay there. I have now stayed there three times and can confirm that it is indeed outstanding. The rooms are spacious and elegantly furnished. The service is excellent. A delicious breakfast is included in the room price. A free computer is available for guests. The public areas are comfortable and relaxing including a garden where one can have breakfast in good weather. There is free parkiing which is unusual in city hotels. The hotel is in a quiet location at the water's edge but within walking distance of restaurants, Irish pubs, and the water taxi to various Inner Harbor places. Unlike the big chain hotels the Inn at Henderson's Wharf has character. I would not consider staying anywhere else in Baltimore and strongly recommend it..

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Once Again”
Reviews.Author: lombardote
Reviews.Content: This was probably my 4th or 5th time staying there. It's a great, clean hotel with very courteous staff. Will keep going back for sure. It's the best deal in Fells Point/Baltimore for sure and a great place to stay...plus free parking unlike most of the hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: U646
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at Henderson Wharf Inn. This time we had a corner room facing the wharf. We will keep coming back. Comfortable, classy rooms, a free bottle of wine, and the best complimentary breakfast you will find. You can't beat the location if you want to visit the pubs and resturants in Fell's Point. Parking in free at the marina right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: pauliepalmz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location in Fell's Point- lots of bars, pubs and little shops. We were there for a girls weekend and it was perfect- the wine, robes, high thread count sheets and most excellent breakfast were some of the high points. It was nice not to have any kids hanging around- very quiet and serene. Everyone was super friendly and eager to help with our endless questions (thanks, Frank for directing us to your hotel when we got a little lost- lifesaver! ) We checked out some of the other places to stay- and this really is the best choice.

Reviews.Title: “WOW, one more time!”
Reviews.Author: foredeck
Reviews.Content: Once again we were happy to be guests at The Inn at Henderson's Wharf. The room was first class and well appointed. We loved the plush bath robes and awesome towels. We were allowed to select the complementary wine of our choice upon arrival. (we chose a white). The Inn is quiet yet a short distance to Little Italy and the Inner Harbor. The front desk extended our free parking on our day of departure so we could explore Fells Point on foot (you should too) The bed was a tad too soft for our tastes. Otherwise we were very happy with our visit. The hotel staff was excellent. We are already looking forward to our visit.

Reviews.Title: “An incredible find I stumbled on searching for Baltimore hotels.”
Reviews.Author: PamPamTulip
Reviews.Content: Great location, beautiful view from room, lovely furnishings, compimentary wine, comfy bed and incredible staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Terrible Pillows"”
Reviews.Author: earlwb
Reviews.Content: Based on the rave reviews here - we stayed at this Inn in early December for a business trip. The hotel is quaint and in an excellent location. However, we found the service to be lacking and the ground floor room not as expected. The rooms are right on the boardwalk - so you can not keep your shades open to look at the view without risking being in a fish bowl for every passerby. All rooms are on the ground floor and those facing the harbor are right/ directly on the boardwalk. To enjoy the vista you will have zero privacy. The bed was very uncomfortable and the pillows were really bad! They are stuffed full of lumpy cotton. When we asked if we could have a flatter pillow (honestly these pillows are cheap and overstuffed), they told us that was all they have. You can get a better pillow at a Hampton Inn. The bed and the pillow are important to a successful stay. All and all we were disappointed. Would not stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous water view!”
Reviews.Author: historyz-fan
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room with a view of the harbor and were not disappointed. The room was lovely and the water view was exceptional. We kept the windows open most of the time to enjoy the view of the water, large ships in the distance and small boats bobbing on the waves, and ducks paddling on the water. We didn't mind the few people going by, most were either running or walking their dogs and few bothered to look at the open windows. The room was clean and comfortable and the breakfast buffet selection was very large and delicious. We enjoyed 24 hour coffee, tea and cocoa availability in the lobby, and the room was also equipped with a full size coffeemaker and plenty of coffee and tea, which was re-supplied immediately upon request. There was a small but nicely appointed exercise room that residents and guests both could use. The staff was always pleasant. However, I didn't like the shampoo and conditioner (my hair is dry) and the printer for the one computer that was available for guests' use was backed up and unable to print a couple of times. Overall, our trip to Baltimore was delightful, even with all the rain that week, and a large part of our good memories will be the lovely water views from our hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Never disappoints!”
Reviews.Author: dcpatti
Reviews.Content: I've been lucky enough to stay at Henderson's Wharf many times for business meetings and just spent a romantic weekend away with my boyfriend there, too. The hotel is consistently spotless, the staff is always helpful and friendly, and the rooms are all spacious, comfortable and elegant. My only complaint is that all of the hotel rooms are on the first floor-- the rest of the building is condo's--- being a single woman often travelling solo for work, first-floor rooms make me nervous. I've never had a reason to feel unsafe here; the lobby is always staffed and never seen any weirdo's hanging around, but if you (like me) prefer feeling a little more secure, opt for a water view room or a garden view room instead of the run-of-the-house or street-view which tend to be in the very foremost hallway of the hotel. At least further back, someone would have to walk past the lobby attendant to enter. But don't let my paranoia turn you off--- actually this is the only first-floor hotel room I've ever been able to get a good night's sleep in! Rooms: the beds are super comfy, plenty of crisp linens and warm duvet. Everything smells and looks super clean. Even the carpet is thick and luxurious. My boyfriend wasn't crazy about the pillows though. Parking: it's in a lot next to the marina across the street. When you arrive, park in the "Hotel Parking Only" spots in front of the hotel, get your room key and that will let you in and out of the lot. Finding the place: the signage isn't great so if it's your first visit, there really is a hotel where your GPS says there is. It just doesn't have a big sign. The "Hotel Parking Only" sign is the best landmark. This really is one of my favorite hotels anywhere. The prices can't be beat, especially when you factor in the free parking and continental breakfast. And the welcome bottle of wine is a really nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: SAMNBOB
Reviews.Content: It's no wonder this hotel is rated as #1 in Baltimore's inner harbor; it's really a hidden gem! The large harborview room was well-appointed and spotless; the staff was friendly and helpful; the common asreas were elegant; and, the service was amazing, The price included a knock-your-sox-off breakfast, secure parking, complimentary bottle of wine, 100 channels on a flat screen TV, and a newspaper at our door every morning. We read the reviews before boolking a room and thought it just couldn't be as good as folks say it is. We were pleasantly surprised to find it was better - an outstanding experience. We'd recommend this hotel to friends and we'd stay here again without thinking twice!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location, design, comfort, breakfast, and, best of all, service.”
Reviews.Author: whatsmacallit
Reviews.Content: I needed a pleasant place to stay after an outpatient operation at Johns Hopkins and decided on Henderson's Wharf Inn after considerable "study" on line. From the moment I telephoned and spoke to Ian, until the moment I left (with regret), it was a marvelous experience. Ian was exceptionally understanding and accommodating, and I arrived to find that I had what must have been the best room in the house, right on a corner of the wharf with floor length windows so I felt as if I were on a luxury yacht in the harbor. The room itself was huge and the decor appropriate, tasteful and restrained. The bed could not have been more comfortable. The excellent breakfast was served in the lobby overlooking a lovely garden mews. The staff was unfailingly pleasant and helpful. I am actually looking forward to my next hospital visit as it will give me a chance to stay at Henderson's Wharf Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a quiet weekend away”
Reviews.Author: TLBHoboken_NewJersey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I left our 3 young kids home for a weekend away. Stayed in room 104 which was lovely - on the boardwalk overlooking the harbor. Definitely stay in a harbor view room. I booked late and had to spend the second night in 133 overlooking the garden and the room loses much of its charm. Regardless, the rooms are tastefully decorated with unusual character like the original brick interior walls that makes it feel cozy. The rooms also offer other nice touches like fresh flowers, wine, nice soaps, bathrobes, etc. The location is convenient and in a neat old part of town but the inner harbor is only about a 10 - 15 minute walk. It's a nice walk with lots of cute shops and restaurants so we enjoyed it. The service at the hotel was great and the continental breakfast was excellent. Don't let the 3 star hotel rating scare you - it's only because it doesn't have amenities like pools and spas etc necessary to get the higher hotel ratings. If you don't mind not having a pool, you can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: NCBallboy
Reviews.Content: Before going, I read the reviews.........no place could be that good, I thought. I was wrong. Henderson's Wharf Inn is a GREAT place to stay. The accolades given in other reviews are not overstated. It's easy to understand how TripAdvisor rated it the best of Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel lived up to it's top rating!”
Reviews.Author: travelin_fool_154
Reviews.Content: The service at Henderson's Wharf Inn was superb. The Front Desk staff were always helpful and pleasant. The room was immaculate and bed was extremely comfortable. The bottle of wine was a nice touch but we didn't get a chance to drink it. Oh well, maybe next time. We did enjoy the continental breakfast the following morning. There was a large selection and it was very fresh. The only negative was the room location as I was told it was a partial harbor view, but you could not see the harbor at all, just a view of the parking lot and the harbor was around the corner. We were only there one night so all in all no big deal. We did walk around the Harbor and Inner Harbor area, but it was a long walk. It was good exercise though!

Reviews.Title: “Just gets better every time!”
Reviews.Author: AmishLou
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated my birthday at our favorite place -- Henderson's Wharf Inn! We love Baltimore and all there is to do there, but more importantly than the town is the place -- and this is it! There is just this feeling of "ahhh" as you walk in, feeling like you've just entered the home of a dear friend. From the welcoming lobby (and front desk staff) to the wine in your room to the beautiful furnishings, you'll know within ten minutes of your arrival that you picked the right place! The rooms are very large and furnished like a bedroom out of a model home. You will not feel in the least like you are staying in a hotel! The mattresses and sheets are top of the line -- you'll get a wonderful night's sleep! The breakfast is just incredible with every sort of fresh fruit, crunchy granola, a large assortment of fresh breads and pastries, cheese and crackers, many fresh fruits -- you name it, it's there! I took pictures but somehow they got deleted from my camera card and I'm very disappointed because I've described this place to my friends, but it's not until they saw the pictures on my camera that they realized how truly unique and wonderful this place is. The front desk staff will attend to your every need and are so gracious and pleasant to deal with. The Inn at Henderson's Wharf combines the best of a Bed and Breakfast (charm, good food, warm ambiance) with the privacy and luxury of an upscale hotel. The water taxi comes within a few minutes of the front door -- it gets you wherever you want to go in Baltimore within minutes at a very low cost. We would never consider staying anywhere else when we're in Baltimore and in fact consider the Inn a destination in itself!

Reviews.Title: “PLANNING OUR NEXT VISIT”
Reviews.Author: tomcpa
Reviews.Content: First time my wife and I ever planned our next visit to a place we just left! Our first visit, yet we were treated like regulars. The hospitality and service provided by the staff exceeded that of any hotel I have ever visited. A short walk to Fells Point attractions and the water taxi to Baltimores Inner Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding venue for accommodations and meeting”
Reviews.Author: wmitz
Reviews.Content: This is an outstanding hotel on the Baltimore waterfront, in a neighborhood with lots of restaurants and pubs. We used it for a small 2 day meeting with 50 participants from all over the world. The accommodations were first class, but more importantly the staff, headed by Mary Ann Grissinger, provided outstanding service for all aspects of the meeting. Every small detail was thought of and handled in a professional manner. We can recommend this venue with unqualified enthusiasm

Reviews.Title: “Understated, pleasant, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: erdocmdca
Reviews.Content: I live just outside Baltimore; decided to spend the night in Baltimore as a splurge after an important day in the city. This was my second stay at this hotel. Great service, small hotel, very very comfortable rooms. My first stay was an interior room looking out on the courtyard; my second was a water view. I'm not sure that the steep price increase for the water view is worth it, because the interior room was equally well-appointed and cozy. In any case, the whole property is underpriced for what you get. The breakfast spread is spectacular and varied, with wicker trays for you to take your selection back to your room. My favorite hotel recently.

Reviews.Title: “What a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: LibertyMoscow_PA
Reviews.Content: This inn has everything. The employees were friendly and very helpful in explaining the best ways to do the activities that we wanted to do. Our room faced the harbor and was sparkling clean, very well appointed and large. I was happy to find a mounted magnifying mirror in the bathroom, helpful to me for makeup application. Each room has its own 50-gallon water heater, so there's no problem with a lack of hot water. The bed was heavenly....great for excellent sleeping. Continental breakfast is served from 7 to 10am. There is a selection of not only the expected bagels, croissants, pastries, etc., but there are soft cooked eggs, cereals (hot & cold), cottage cheese, cheese & crackers, and a huge variety of fresh fruit (blueberries, blackberries, strawberries, cantelope, melon, pineapple), fruit juices, coffee, tea, cocoa & milk. You can eat indoors or in a very peaceful outdoor courtyard or you can take your breakfast to your room to enjoy. It's Fell's Point location is calmer than the busy Inner Harbor area and there is a FREE parking lot at the marina next to the hotel. We enjoyed dinner at a great pub, The Red Star on Wolfe Street, on the first night and then at Meli's on Thames Street the second. The water taxi dock is approximately a 3 block walk and will take you everywhere into and around the Inner Harbor area. For $9 you can ride all day! Don't miss the 4-D show or the Australian exhibit at the National Aquarium. Wear your sneakers...there are cobblestone streets!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: daffund
Reviews.Content: I'm a huge fan of impeccably clean things - and this hotel made me a fan!! It was beautiful, comfortable, and the view was very nice! There were fresh flowers in the bathroom and live plants in the room, which I loved! And although I couldn't enjoy the free wine (due to pregnancy), it was a very nice touch! The breakfast was delicious, lots of fresh fruit and different varieties. It was very quiet, so I slept wonderfully! And the room was HUGE! It made us very happy! The walk around the corner to the restaurants/pubs was very nice and short. It's very close to the museums and aquarium and tons of shopping. We will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: BeverlyMA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the way to the AutoTrain to Florida last December on Christmas Day. Been meaning to write review! Now we are planning our trip to Florida for the winter again. Henderson's Wharf was so beautiul, as everyone says; room was comfortable, toiletries luxurious, breakfast perfect! Our only disappointment was that everything else was closed in the area, as it was Christmas. But that was our itinerary. The staff did recommend us to a pub that was open, right down the street, where the only thing we could get to eat were spiced steamed shrimp.(and we got the last of those!!) So no crabcakes, but boy, were those shrimp good!! This year going earlier so we can actually enjoy Fells Point a little and get those elusive crabcakes. We're sure the staff will recommend the best place for those!! We just loved the look of the area--we are from the Boston area so we loved the old buildings, waterfront. It might have cost a little more to stay there for just a stop on the way somewhere else, as opposed to a Comfort Inn , etc, but well worth it. Can't wait to get there again....

Reviews.Title: “NOTHING BUT THE BEST !!”
Reviews.Author: Linda7956
Reviews.Content: I cannot say anything but the best about the Hendersons Wharf Inn. When we arrived at the Inn we were amazed at how beautiful the entrance way was. The lobby was so warm and inviting. When we walked into our rooms we did a high five to one another, The room was so cozy and looked just like it did in the pictures on Trip Advisor. Your bottle of wine is given to you when you arrive. The breakfeast brunch in the morning was so wonderful. The best I have ever had. The staff were so nice they went out of their way to make your stay the best. The cleaning staff in the morning were so kind. The management, one in particuar Nancy was so kind. She printed out reviews of different resteraunts in the area and sat with me twice. I felt like I knew her forever. Nancy if you are reading this ....thanks for the box of candy. It was great. I would never stay anywhere else . The Hendersons is better than home. We just went in August and plan to go again in October , but this time bring our in parents. Every year after this the Hendersons Inn will be our visit twice a year. Thanks to everyone at Hendersons Inn.......

Reviews.Title: “excellent value, great stay”
Reviews.Author: RexKite
Reviews.Content: stayed with wife & 3 kids, great location, great value, great facilities. Great breakfast. highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Getaway”
Reviews.Author: PeterJ73
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a last minute trip to Baltimore. We stayed at the Inn and had a perfect evening and day. The staff was friendly and exceptionally helpful. The rooms were well appointed and clean. The welcome bottle of wine was a nice touch. When asked for a recommendation for dinner, the gentleman at the desk quickly recommended La Scalia, secured us a reservation and made arrangements for a round-trip, no cost shuttle. The speed in which he had things setup had me a little worried as I have been burnt in the past by mediocre restaurants buying customers through hotel recommendation but in this case I shouldn't have. The shuttle was on time, the restaurant perfect for a romantic dinner and the food was exceptional. All-in-all, a perfect getaway!!! Highly recommend both the Wharf Inn and La Scalia!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming escape!”
Reviews.Author: MadAnthony
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful getaway! The rooms had great character. The bed was comfortable. The amenities were terrific. A bottle of wine at check in and nice continental breakfast in the courtyard made our stay even more special. The location is quiet and also extraordinarily convenient. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a Great Area”
Reviews.Author: pkleinJersey
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three day trip to Baltimore with three of my girlfriends. Stayed here based on the reviews on TripAdvisor, and again, the reviewers are right...this place is No. 1! The rooms are well appointed with beautiful furniture, the staff at the desk are outstanding; the continental breakfast had a great choice of items and the freshest fruit we have ever eaten. We never went hungry at breakfast! The hotel is two blocks from the water taxi and numerous shops, bars and great little restaurants. The hotel staff's recommendations for food were right on...let them know what you are in the mood for, and they know the best places to get it! While it takes two water taxi's to get to the inner harbor, this hotel is not right in the thick of things, and that's what adds to its charm. The water taxis come often enough and it is a very relaxing way to get around. I will definitely be returning to Henderson's Wharf and soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular, better than the New York Palace”
Reviews.Author: druggist87
Reviews.Content: This inn was wonderful, beautiful and spacious rooms and bathroom. Our room had a great view of the harbor, I really cannot say enough good things. The breakfast had a large selection of fresh fruit, bagels and cereal with coffee, tea and hot chocolate available 24 hours a day. Ok the negative was, in Fells Point there are really only pubs and ice cream shops you must walk (20--25 minutes) or water taxi to the inner harbor for restaurants. But then you can return to the Inn and escape.

Reviews.Title: “this place is great in everyway!!!”
Reviews.Author: jbone-drubone
Reviews.Content: I went with my parents and had a blast! The hotel was wonderful, breakfast was fresh fruit, pastries, etc.. was just perfect! The hotel staff was so knowledgable, they told us all the local places to eat and have a drink. The hotel even gives a bottle of wine, when you check in. The location is the best. Right by the water taxi pick up and on the harbor. The rooms were huge and had a beautiful view!! (our view was the harbor, well worth the extra money.) I was totally surprised how well everything went. I can usually find something wrong with most places, but nothing here!! Totally will go again and recommend to friends and family!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LongIslandSunnygrl
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel here on tripadvisor and it really lived up to the reviews! Only stayed one night (wish it could have been more) but it was really great. Upgraded from a garden view to a two bed harbor view, we really loved it. Big room, very very clean, very nice service. Liked the bottle of wine at check-in, the 24-hour coffee/tea service, and the continental breakfast was great. Free parking in the city is terrific. I would definitely stay here again - might go to Baltimore just to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “What a Find!”
Reviews.Author: Pokieman2
Reviews.Content: We stayed a this hotel for two nights before departing on a cruise out of Baltimore. Our room looked out over the water. Really a great place to stay if you are visiting Baltimore. Excellent service. Lovely continental breakfast. Beautiful courtyard for unwinding after a hectic day of sightseeing. (Don't miss the aquarium, by the way. When I thought aquarium, I thought endless tanks of fish. Not so! The design of the place is amazing.) The room was richly appointed and the bed was heaven. Firmish matress with a really thick pillow top. We slept sooo well. Hate to say anything negative about the place but I want the review to be complete. The one drawback was the washroom. Trendy bowl sink and fresh flowers. Nice. Howwwwwever, the toilet is crunched in a corner and the small tub leaves a lot to be desired. A separate shower and soaking tub would have made this room A+. Given the design of the Inn and the decor and spaciousness of the room, we wondered why they didn't create a nicer space in the washroom, when the reno was staged. Just a thought and it in no way spoiled the two nights we stayed at this great property. Would recommend it, in a heartbeat, to anyone visiting Baltimore!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Susiesmom
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel based on reviews and the fact that it was $100 cheaper than hotels (big box national chains) right at Harborside. Turned out to be my favorite hotel of all time! Quiet, beautiful rooms, wonderful accommodating staff, wonderful brunch included (8 types of berries, BIG tubs of yogurt, not the now-standard 4 oz.), plush towels, Cuddledown pillows and sheets. It's on the water, beautiful view. Walked 2 short blocks to take the Water Taxi to Harborside, runs all day untill 11 PM in summer so no problems getting around. This was a luxurious boutique hotel at a reasonable price. I would love to LIVE there!

Reviews.Title: “Charming in every way!!!”
Reviews.Author: bandman
Reviews.Content: We flew into Baltimore on our way to Pennsylvania and decided to stay in the Fell’s Point area for the weekend before flying back home. The Inn at Henderson Wharf was the perfect location for us! They include parking, internet, and breakfast in the price of the room. The desk staff is very nice and accommodating in every manner possible. The rooms are simple, but elegant, with beautiful stained beds and TV stands, and a nice little writing desk overlooking the harbor! This hotel was wonderful for the three of us, but this is the perfect hotel for a romantic getaway! The neighborhood lends itself perfectly to a couple who just wants to have a perfect weekend together!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: faithzp
Reviews.Content: What to say.? From beginning to end the stay was near perfect. I love the layout of the hotel like a one floor ranch house. Yah, no elevators. My 9 year old niece especially love the small business cubicle ( with its computer) and the complimentary tea and hot chocolate. Breakfast was the best I have ever had at a hotel. The decorations for the holiday were great. We ended up very fortunate the weather for Dec. 30th was wonderful. So, we were able to walk from the inner harbor back to the hotel. I am not going to lie it is a trek and I walk alot. There were times we would just catch a taxi in front of the Marriott near the inner harbor. There are few places I say are a do-over, the Henderson's Wharf is just such a place. It helped me fall in love with Fell's Point even more and the beauty of the historical area. Being in a place where history was living and still looks like it is fabulous. Terrific helpful, interested staff.

Reviews.Title: “A Five Star Experience at a Two to Three Star Price”
Reviews.Author: MargaretfromVirginia
Reviews.Content: This thirty-eight room hotel on the harbor at historic Fells Point offers its guests a truly 'five star' experience at two to three star Inner Harbor hotel prices. However, unlike these hotels which charge a parking fee, parking at Henderson's Wharf is free! For the hardy traveler Fells Point is about a half an hour walk to the Inner Harbor/Camden Yards area; for the less hardy, the hotel is a two block walk to Ed Kaine's Water Taxis which will take you to East Harbor, Inner Harbor/Camden Yards and Ft. McHenry ($9 for an all day on/off pass). The water taxi option worked for us until we left Camden Yards in a deluge and opted for a ‘land’ taxi ride back to the hotel ($11). The staff is more than terrific. Each person was gracious and accommodating; most importantly, each was knowledgeable about the Fells Point area’s history, shops and restaurants. When we asked for a recommendation for a seafood restaurant, the young man at the desk (Terence) and I had about a 10-minute conversation until the choice of restaurants was narrowed to one which met our specific preferences: Black Olive on Bond Street near Broadway Square, a 10-minute walk from the hotel. We had a wonderful continental breakfast (included) in the hotel courtyard. On the second night, we were upgraded to a corner room with a harbor view. In addition, when we asked if our parking could be extended beyond the noon check-out time so that we could explore more of Fells Point, the response was “Of course.” The attention to detail and customer service makes this hotel a star. The complimentary bottle of wine (red or white) in your room, the Molton Brown bath products, and the newspaper hanging from the doorknob in a burlap bag are a few of the amenities that make the Henderson Wharf Inn outshine the galaxy of Inner Harbor competitors. (We stayed at the Inn based on the reviews we read in Trip Advisor.)

Reviews.Title: “great experience, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: arvidd9
Reviews.Content: On two visits to Henderson's Wharf Inn in June 2009, I found an exceptionally cordial and helpful staff from our first phone reservation to our last checkout and goodbye. The facility is well kept with beautifully appointed, spacious rooms and tasteful decor throughout. Unlike some of the other purportedly four- and five-star hotels on the Inner Harbor, this hotel lives up to its promises in every way. The accommodations and service afforded us went beyond our expectations. Great facility, great staff, pleasant laid-back location, and breakfast in the courtyard was superb. It's reasonably priced and includes parking. We'll be back many times.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: professor11
Reviews.Content: We needed a place for the night before our flight out of Baltimore. Considered airport hotels, but decided to stay in the city based on the very positive reviews of Henderson's, and it defintiely lived up to its reputation. The staff was friendly and helpful, the neighborhood is charming, the breakfast (with lot's of fresh fruit) was excellent, and the free parking was convenient and seemed quite secure.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilovenyc
Reviews.Content: we picked this hotel based on previous reviews. It was lovely. we did not have a reservation and Nathan, at front desk, was very accomodating. Our room was nice, on the large size with a lounge chair and desk. the bed was very comfortable. bathroom was a good size. Added bonus!- a free bottle of wine with the room. You can exchange the wine at front desk if you would prefer a differnt type. Breakfast in the morning was continental and very sufficient. I would definitely stay here again if i was visiting baltimore. it is not right in the thick of things but very near by. The hotel itself looks like a renovated brick warehouse right on the edge of the water. price was 160 on a sunday night. very close to little italy with wonderful italian restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “They thought of everything to make it an appealing and comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: monmd
Reviews.Content: Rooms are well-appointed and well-kept with fine details like a vase of fresh flowers in the bathroom and packets of cleansers for computer screens. Lighting is good. Bed is comfortable. Towels are luxurious. Water pressure in shower/bathtub is delicious. As is the fine breakfast. Good coffee and tea and apples available all day. Excellent fitness room. Staff is friendly and polite. They go out of their way to be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most comfortable "in-city" hotels I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: DennisConnecticut
Reviews.Content: We have four children and stayed in two rooms next to one another during the gap between Christmas and New Years Day. Extremely happy with the rooms; very comfortable beds, towels and very much liked the breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, view and location”
Reviews.Author: stlouisblues
Reviews.Content: I came to Baltimore with my teenage son to look at Johns Hopkins University. What an unexpected delight and surprise. After driving in the rain for what seemed like forevever from Washington DC after taking two college tours, we checked into our harbor view room. It was spacious and well appointed with a complimentary bottle of wine as well. The front staff was friendly, courteous and very helpful. They had menus from the local restaurants along with a map of how to get there. The breakfast bar consisted of fresh pineapple, strawberries, blueberries, cantelope and honewdew. What a treat and the coffe was perfect. I will definitely stay here again when we are in Baltimore and I would reccomennd this well run establishment to any and everyone.

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: CDNMaryland
Reviews.Content: My husband, two year old daughter and I spent a night at Henderson's Wharf to celebrate my husband's birthday. This Fells Point location is a great place to stay. The service, from booking our room through check-out, was impeccable. You receive a bottle of wine upon check in and get a delicious breakfast in the morning , as well. Our harbor side room was large and beautifully decorated. They were very accommodating, as we changed our minds and requested a crib late in the evening, which arrived in a matter of minutes). I highly recommend this inn and will definitely check availability for future getaways to downtown Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful oasis”
Reviews.Author: golemlee
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I have stayed here... I love it. I have only stayed in the Harborside rooms..so cannot comment on the others..but they are spacious, comfortable and quiet with gorgeous views. The continental breakfast is fresh and plentiful... We love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Sssooo Charming!!!”
Reviews.Author: lcsmith
Reviews.Content: Only spent 1 night here but wish we could've stayed longer. Staff was 1st rate, room was perfect...very warm, romantic and relaxing. The view was fabulous! We don't drink, but the bottle of wine was a nice touch. The free continental breakfast was a nice start to the day. THIS IS THE PLACE TO STAY while in Baltimore!

Reviews.Title: “excellent boutique hotel in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Fred_from_Chicago
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure of spending 3 nights in this location, and again it was a great experience. The room we had faced the front of the building and it was quiet, very clean, linens comfortable and immaculate, towels quite new and fluffy. I enjoyed the bottle of wine that comes with the room. The gym is spacious and has great equipment, and their complimentary breakfast is outstanding. Aside from the great location, the hotel staff went out of their way to help me have and find a great time in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly my favorite hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Entropia8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic; clean, really nice looking, very comfortable, great location, wonderful staff, nice breakfast in the morning, unique character, and a bottle of wine when you check in :) You can’t beat it. I have nothing bad to say about this place, I love it and would eagerly stay again. It is located in Fells Point Baltimore, which is full of cute little restaurants, shops, coffee houses, fun bars, and is right on the water. We had a gigantic private-ish window that looked out on the peer and was just a few feet away from the water. We were there in the winter, but it was still very lovely. The room had exposed brick walls, nice paintings, a cute desk; it was quite spacious, had a mini bar, nice windows, good TV, nice bathroom and was very clean. It really was nice. That's all I have to say, it really might have been my favorite hotel, and I've stayed at quite a few. I recommend it if you are there to have a nice, relaxing weekend and are not to cost conscious (or if you've found a good deal).

Reviews.Title: “Peerless spot on the docks!”
Reviews.Author: The_Car_Is_Packed
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great stay Saturday night at the Henderson's Wharf Inn. The hotel, an extensively renovated brick former warehouse, is stately, nicely furnished, and clean. There are a lot of (original?) brick walls in the room and elsewhere, which I find attractive. Our room -- 101 just off the lobby -- was advertised as "partial harbor view," but I think I'd drop the "partial". As long as you're not bothered looking out the window into the eyes of occasional passersby, the view of boats bobbing in the harbor was picturesque. The room was large, nicely furnished, and warm (literally and otherwise). The king bed was comfortable and the shower worked well (huge shower head!). The room's extras made an impression, too: free bottle of wine, good in-room coffee and tea, nice shampoos and lotions, and the most fully-stuffed (and reasonably priced) set of mini-bar snacks I've seen. Every hotel should offer an assortment of $2.00 candy bars in the room. The continental brunch buffet in the lobby is very nice, too. Wide assortment of fresh melons, berries, cereals, and pastries, along with juices and coffee. Adjacent parking (in their private gated lot) is included. The location is prime, with a short walk to most of Fells Point's restaurants and night spots. Only one sour note worth mentioning: the impressively renovated room had a 3-inch hole in the base of the exterior brick wall. I don't think it connected all the way with the outside, but it was a little unsettling regardless. More attention to detail, please. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The Inn is a pretty quiet place, at least during our stay, and offered very nice accommodations for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely stellar”
Reviews.Author: stella_luna33
Reviews.Content: My husband, 7-year-old daughter, and I just returned from a weekend getaway to Baltimore, which we happily spent at Henderson's Wharf Inn. What a delightful place! It was gorgeous and impeccably clean. The area of the city was beautiful, with cobblestone streets and lots of shops and restaurants. It seemes to be a very safe area. The property was only a 20-minute walk to the aquarium. The staff could not have been nicer. They looked up directions to an event I wanted to attend on Mapquest and printed them out for me. The breakfast was unbelieveable--I wish I knew where they found such fresh, sweet, delicious raspberries and blackberries in December. All good quality, fresh food. The free, secure parking and a free bottle of wine just rounded out the stay for us.

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderful”
Reviews.Author: CTNan
Reviews.Content: I looked on TripAdvisor for a location in Baltimore and liked the reviews given to the property. It was fabulous. The room was lovely, the location an easy walk to the city, the staff helpful and courteous, and the breakfast excellent. We wished to stay an additional evening and they were able to accommodate us at the last moment. We loved our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ado18
Reviews.Content: Excellent ...................Just loved it......Would defo go back again & again

Reviews.Title: “comfortably sumptuous”
Reviews.Author: needysailor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the start and the end of a weeks holiday from the UK visiting Baltimore , Washington and NY. First impressions of its wharfside location and unique building suggest that it is something special. Inside , the welcome was genuine and extended well beyond the standard 'have a good day'. As the stay progressed it was clear that the staff seemed proud to work at Hendersons. The rooms have a well equipped homely decadence. Features are original and comfort is total , the complimentary bottle of wine adding to the seduction. Breakfast is a lesson in how to present a quality choice rather than heaps of mid-range mediocrity. We have not been more impressed by any hotel in this category. Outside, boats are bobbing at their moorings and a King Neptune lookalike called Richard offered a typical friendly greeting . The Fells Road area is cobbled and full of character shops and pub/restaurants. It is one of those rare places that we would unequivocally recommend and look forward to staying in again.

Reviews.Title: “Believe all the reviews – don’t stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: NJtraveler40
Reviews.Content: I recently extended a business trip a few extra days, decided to avoid the chain hotels, and made reservations at Henderson’s Wharf Inn. It’s the smartest thing I’ve done in a long time! The inn is ideally situated in Fell’s Point, within walking distance to Baltimore’s Inner Harbor. The inn’s entrance, lobby, and rooms are nicely decorated and very comfortable. The inn provides luxurious robes, a complimentary bottle of wine, and a well-stocked snack and beverage bar. The Inn also provides complimentary breakfast, which is enough to get you going in the mornings. You can enjoy your breakfast, weather permitting, in their courtyard garden. It’s worth noting that the inn’s guest rooms are on the first floor with either marina or garden views. The floors above are residences, which add to the appeal. You never quite feel like a tourist, and instead feel quite at home. The cobblestone streets, shops, pubs (lots of them), cafés and restaurants of Fell’s Point might keep you busy and away from the Inner Harbor. However, if you do remember to visit the harbor, you're within walking distance. The walk will take you along the water’s edge, or you can just as easily take the water-taxis that will take you back and forth all day long for one fare. Please try the taxis at nights; the city lights are wonderful at night! I’ll be returning again, and will only consider staying at Henderson’s Wharf Inn!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: myconcordtravel
Reviews.Content: WOW, This was a girls' night away for our birthdays and I now know why it is #1 Best Hotel in Baltimore and #3 HIdden Gem in the USA. They are very proud of these ratings and want to stay at the top. Service was great, room was so large and beautiful view especially in the morning when the sun was rising over the boats in the Harbor. What a bargain, wine upon arrival, free secure parking including the full day when we checked out, breakfast what a selection of fruit and the pound cake was to die for. The bedding and towells were the best. I feel they did not scrimp on anything. My only regret about posting on Trip Advisor and tellilng all of my friends about this great find is.............it won't be available when I want to come back with my husband, and I will be back. Fells Point is a great town to visit and check out all the little shops and make sure to stop at John Steven, Ltd., 1800 Thames St., [--] what a great lunch, the cream crab soup was the best I have ever had. The water taxi is convenient and great way to get around without driving. I really can't wait to go back and experience more of Fells Point and Henderson's Wharf Inn

Reviews.Title: “Love it,Love it, Love it!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sun-starved
Reviews.Content: Everything you read is true. My husband and I stayed at Henderson's for a short one night getaway. We had stayed there a couple of years ago and loved it then too. No detail is overlooked. Everyone is courteous and helpful. Rooms are beautiful and comfortable. Location is convenient to everything in Fell's Point. Breakfast is wonderful. It is the perfect spot for a romantic getaway. DON'T CHANGE A THING!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Henderson's Wharf!”
Reviews.Author: HammerDE
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently booked a little 3 day get-away at the Henderson's Wharf. We talked to others we met during our stay that booked other hotels and they were envious when hearing all the amenities we received included in our price. Parking was free and located in an easily accessible lot right next to the hotel. We stayed in a harbor view room which was nicely appointed and not your typical run of the mill hotel room. The wall facing outside was all brick with an overhead arch surrounding the 3 large windows looking out to the water. We never felt cramped as these are decent sized rooms. There is also a stocked snack and mini-bar if you care to purchase anything. The bathrooms are also large with good water pressure from the large showerhead. Included in the price were robes to use, a bottle of wine of your choosing and a large continental breakfast selection ranging from fruit, cereal, bagels, donuts, juices, milk and coffee. At the time of booking, no King beds were available so we booked two queens. This actually worked out nicely. We happened to book 10/5 thru 10/7 and were able to enjoy the Fell's Point festival as an added bonus. The town is quaint with an historic feel with their cobble stone roads and buildings kept with a "revolutionary age look". There are many bars and restaurants in Fell's point and Little Italy section is minutes away by car or 15 - 20 minute walk if its nice outside. Also, the water taxi to Inner harbor is a 5 minute walk from the hotel to take advantage of any shopping or eateries you may want to visit there. It was nice though to get back to Henderson's Wharf at the end of each day to relax in a very comfortable and cozy atmosphere. The staff was very friendly and ready to help with any information or questions you have about the area. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning to stay in Fell's Point or the Inner harbor area.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaPhxtraveler
Reviews.Content: From start to finish, I experienced the best service ever. The reservation process was easy, the check-in procedure was smooth and made me feel very welcome. The staff was extremely professional and accommodating. The hotel was clean and very comfortable. Great location in Fell's Point. I would highly recommend this to all my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a true hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: lizardnc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled home to Baltimore to catch a Raven's game this past weekend. We do not get to travel too much without the kids, so we took the opportunity to spend the night away after leaving the kids with the grandparents. :) We had not stayed at Henderson's before, but after reading all of the great reviews on Tripadvisor I felt compelled to stay there. The reviewers were right on the money when they say this hotel is awesome! We felt at home as soon as we checked in, and hated to check out this morning. We were in room 134, and while that was close to the lobby we could not hear anything out there. The breakfast was phenomenal, and the extras such as the wine and the robes were a bonus. Our only complaint was that the air conditioning was a bit noisy, but that was nothing compared to the awesome stay that we had. I am already looking to book a night or two in December, and hope this time to stay in a Harborview room.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful getaway”
Reviews.Author: pj2005
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay at Henderson's for our first anniversary. We wanted to visit the aquarium and other Inner Harbor attractions and had debated about staying here vs staying at a cheaper location and driving in. We decided based on the reviews and the hassle and cost of driving/parking to go ahead and stay. We are so very glad we made that choice and will come back without reservation. It was very restful. Very quiet. We called ahead to ask about an evening activity we were looking into, and the front desk offered to make the calls for us and let us know! The rooms are very comfortable and breakfast was fantastic, and generous. The aquarium was a bit of a walk, but we could have opted for the water taxi. There is plenty of dining nearby. It was a great choice for our anniversary and we hope to return sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: christine c
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 days for my 30th birthday and it was simply amazing. I am a huge tripadvisor fan so i am always logged on when planning a trip and I have never been disappointed. We caught the Red Sox game the last night they were in town; unfortunately they lost but it was a blast so go to Camden Yards. Back to the Inn-----staff at the front desk is superb. So helpful and couteous and down to earth! The breakfast has all kinds of fruit, yogurt, granola, bagels, juice, coffee, dates, danish and more. The garden area is beautiful to sit outside in the morning or at night and the lobby is breath taking. All of this carries into the rooms as well. They are normal in size and very comfortable. Everything is modern and updated and the mini bar has every snack you can think of!! Plus the wine at check in is a bonus! This place is by far the nicest place to stayi n Fells Point and I cannot wait to go back. Everything is only a block away and the water is always in clear view so it is so relaxing and fun at the same time. Don't miss out and stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed all expectations”
Reviews.Author: DocmomBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and 2 young sons for one night to catch the Red Sox/Orioles game. My only regret is that we didn't stay longer! This place is truly special. The front desk staff was so incredibly friendly, especially to my sons even though we're Red Sox fans! The room was tastefully decorated and the beds were beyond comfortable. The complimentary bottle of wine was a lovely touch. My husband and I shared the bottle in the lovely courtyard that night. Breakfast in the courtyard was just great with the best fresh fruit selection. The water taxi stop is a five minute walk away and the boat ride to and from the Inner Harbor was one of the highlights of our trip. Parking was free at an adjacent lot. We had a harbor front room which was lovely but the courtyard is pretty too so either is really fine. Overall, the price is better than any of the nicer hotels in the Inner Harbor but this place is really SPECIAL. I couldn't recommend this inn more highly.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem Indeed!!!”
Reviews.Author: MAN615
Reviews.Content: Another stay at this fine alternative to the big chains. Second time here, everthing in order, except this time a little A/C problem which occurred at night, causing some sleeping discomfort. The staff was very accomodating the next day, since we stayed for 2 nights. They offered another room and a discount off the room we stayed in the first night for our troubles. I was very pleased. Left our car parked in the lot the whole 2 days(no charge), took the water taxi to Inner Harbor for Orioles game and other Inner Harbor activities. In Fells Point ate at Shuckers, by the water taxi, it was very good. Went to Max's taphouse, maybe the best bar I have ever been to for beer selections!! The fact is, this place is a bargain to stay at since their prices are actually less than any other inner harbor hotel thats worth a darn. All the rooms are on the first floor, so if you are looking for an overall view of the area, you won't get it. The upper floors are owned by tennants. I should also mention the room has lots of candies and drinks in the room for purchase if you want to use them. I have nothing else to say, other than I have recommended the Wharf Inn to 2 friends of mine and both have been blown away by this place. Its a no brainer when in this area.

Reviews.Title: “It's true what they say - this is the only place to stay in Baltimore!”
Reviews.Author: FromLongIslandNY
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice for one night each. Great location in Fell's Point - much better than Inner Harbor. Rooms are like new and the lobby is a great place to gather and have breakfast. Breakfast is perfect and the staff is very friendly. Free self parking. This is the best place I ever found through tripadvisor and I would highly recommended it.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance abounds”
Reviews.Author: TIsaA
Reviews.Content: When I pulled up, I was greeted with a spectacular view of the Harbor. The representatives at the front desk, could not do enough, they were very informative and pleasant on a daily basis. Always with a smile and happy "hello". The room was very clean, nicely appointed and top notch linens, mattresses, and all amenties included with my stay. The daily breakfast setup was always fresh - from the fruit to the coffee. And the garden setting was absolutely calming where we ate breakfast. The location is ideal, just a short water taxi ride to all the attractions. The pubs and shops, at Fells Point, made for a pleasant walk also. In all, I will be back to Henderson's Wharf, and I will spread the word of what a great time I had there.

Reviews.Title: “Our absolute favourite hotel anywhere”
Reviews.Author: ChillyAlbertans
Reviews.Content: After a disappointing stay at the Waldorf in NYC, I was not in a good mood. We hit Henderson's and thought we had died and gone to heaven. The room was magnificent, large, clean, well appointed. The view to the harbour was a real bonus. The complimentary bottle of wine and breakfasts were fabulous touches. The staff (Hi Kelly and Shawn!) were top notch. This room had the largest selection of snacks available in room at reasonable cost that we have ever seen. We love this place. We love the staff. We love location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Giveypup
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely, non-institutional alternative to a large hotel. The staff was helpful and gracious, trying hard to find a lost item of mine, for example. As well, they were very solicitous of how my friend was doing, post-surgery, at Hopkins. They were diligent about calling cabs for us, even once volunteering to drive us in the hotel car when it looked as if the taxi had stood us up (which we were told is a common occurrence in Baltimore). The front desk personnel was also very accurate and spot-on about their restaurant recommendations. I especially appreciated how sound-proof the rooms were, although the substantial construction is likely responsible for our inability to get Wi-fi in our room. The room was clean, and toiletry supplies were replenished without fail. The one criticism I have is that the hotel make sure that their exercise equipment is functioning. A few things didn't work and as the equipment is limited... This is a lovely property staffed by nice, good people. Finally, if you are an art enthusiast, the American Visionary Art Museum is a must--it houses alternative art by not-formally-trained artists and is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “It lived up to #1”
Reviews.Author: McParrot
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because of tripadvisor. It was really nice. We were really happy with our stay there. They didn't charge to park the car. From the moment we walked in we loved it. The breakfast that was included wasn't lke your normal continental breakfasts. They had hard boil eggs. All kinds of fresh breads, cheese, and lots of wonderful fresh fruit. The center courtyard area was very calming too. The area where the hotel is didn't have lots of night life. Lots of bars though. The restaurant across from the water taxi on the pier was very good. Huge menu and bar and not over priced. If you go to a baseball game buy your peanuts and hot dogs before you go in for a buck each.

Reviews.Title: “won't stay anywhere else in Baltimore now”
Reviews.Author: naptraveler
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying at Henderson's Wharf over the weekend, and I can't stop raving about this place. The inn and rooms are adorable. We arrived very late on Friday night. Check in was quick and easy, and we were directed to our ground floor, garden-view room. Our room was spacious, clean, and comfortable. The best part was the bottle of wine awaiting our arrival (trade it in at the front desk if you prefer a different type). The mini bar had a lot to select from at fairly reasonable prices. And the bed was incredibly comfortable. The only thing I would change in the room is the tub--it was small with no lighting--but this in no way changes my opinion about the inn overall. Both mornings we arrived for breakfast around 10:45. I was please to see food was still being brought out from the kitchen, instead of already being taken in, since breakfast on the weekend ends at 11. The breakfast looked and tasted great--it was very filling. Henderson's Wharf is located in a great, convenient area--an easy walk to the restaurants and bars in Fells Point--on a cobblestone street near the water. I should also mention that free, gated parking is included, a great bonus in this area. We loved this inn and plan to stay here anytime we go to Baltimore from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for visiting Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Swede74
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with a scenic location by the water. The inner harbor area is about 20-30 minutes away by foot and it's certainly worth the effort, it's a nice stroll along the water most of the way. The room was spacious and the decoration nice in both the room and in the public areas. Everything was clean and the staff very helpful. The parking is included and there is plenty of space in the gated self parking just outside the hotel. (About half the parking lot was available when we were there). The complimentary wine bottle is a really nice touch and the included continental breakfast is excellent with bagels with really yummy spread and lots of fresh fruit. There are also a few tables so you can enjoy breakfast outdoors.

Reviews.Title: “great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: aggiebones
Reviews.Content: Wow, we had a great time there. It was only an overnight romantic stay without the kids, but we did as much as possible in that night. There was alot to do right near the hotel with a dock and plenty of scenery. Ample choices of restaurants and pubs alike. The staff was very knowledgeable about the local fare as well. The hotel was very nice and peaceful with all the amenities that you would need. If you needed something else, just ask any of the staff, they were very professional and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Superb - Come to Baltimore Just for This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ManorRoad
Reviews.Content: 17-07-08 Very impressed with this hotel, from our arrival onwards. Lovely rooms, caring staff, generous attitude, customer focused... everything was great. Probably the best hotel we have been to in the USA, and one of the best in the world - not necessarily the most luxurious, but the best overall experience. What was good: - room ready when we arrived at 11:30am - no fuss! - great double room, ground floor, with harbour view - wired and wireless internet access free - good TV, with channel guide - free coffee available all day - enjoy it in the secluded courtyard garden - wonderful location: Fells Point in not in the absolute centre of the city, but links by a water taxi. Don't let this put you off! Fells Point is wonderful on its own - restaurants, galleries, ice cream shops, parks - free bottle of wine - we asked for champagne, and they gave us a nice Cava - breakfast included, buffet style - fresh fruit, breads, cereals, juices - as much as you like, again in the courtyard garden - friendly staff - we were having coffee in the garden, and they decided we might be hot, and so brought out some iced water I have no 'buts' or 'howevers' to add to this review: a great hotel. [The cherry on the icing on the cake is that the building used for the great US TV series 'Homicide: Life on the Street' is around the corner. If you can't get to the hotel, watch the TV series!]

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return...”
Reviews.Author: Monalisa12
Reviews.Content: We just returned from staying five days at Henderson's and I just wanted to add our impression. It truly is a wonderful hotel, very clean, the staff was very attentive and all of the special touches are too numerous to list. We loved Fell's Point and can't wait to return to explore it further. The complimentary wine is such a wonderful touch and the breakfast was extremely generous. When we were checking out, we had mentioned to the staff that the air conditioning unit in our room was making some strange noises to the point that it was actually waking us up in the middle of the night. They couldn't have been more apologetic and had offered us another bottle of wine for our trouble, however since we were carrying our luggage on the airplane, we couldn't take it! Thank you Henderson's Wharf family, you made our stay a joy...

Reviews.Title: “Elegance at it's best”
Reviews.Author: LIDuck428
Reviews.Content: We read previous reviews on Trip Advisor so we figured it was going to be great stay. I guess I didn't realize what a beautiful property and extremely friendly staff I was going to encounter. The linens and room decor were outstanding. The bed was soooo comfortable. Although I didn't partake in the "mini bar", it was the most expansive one I've ever seen. Continental breakfast in the morning was also a choice of many items - all wonderful. Eating in the garden was exquisite. I'm only sorry we could only stay one night. I'm looking forward to any excuse to visit Baltimore and Henderson's once again!

Reviews.Title: “Rave Reviews Were Right”
Reviews.Author: AllAboutEve08
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our first visit to Baltimore and were pleased to find the Inn as pleasant as the previous reviewers had said.
