I would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there during future visits to my son in college. Lovely little touchs like fresh flowers in the bathroom, a complimentary bottle of wine (with other options should you not care for their choice), your morning paper hung from the door handle in a little bag so you don't have to pick it up off the floor, all add to the experience. We are so glad we stayed here rather than downtown or the touristy Inner Harbor. You can catch a water taxi to the Inner Harbor if you want to go to an Orioles game or to walk to Edgar Allen Poe's gravesite. The cost is $9 per person but is good for the whole day and they run late to accomodate baseball fans. As other reviewers said, the complimentary breakfast was excellent. We had nice weather so we ate in the courtyard next to a fountain. They did not skimp on breakfast either, offering things like fresh blackberries and a tasty lemon pound cake. I only noticed two things that could be improved. There is no concierge on duty, so if you need to get tickets to an event, you are going to have to bring a laptop or use the lobby computer. We had to use the one in the lobby. Another guest was using it for an extended time when we tried to get tickets, so the staff was nice enough to let us use one in their office. The second thing I want to note can't really be improved upon, but I mention it if you are concerned with privacy. If your room is on the first floor facing the harbor you will have early morning joggers running right outside your window, so you might want to close the shutters before you go to bed. All in all, those were minor drawbacks and would not deter me from staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: sjopa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Inn At Henderson's Wharf, Fells Point for our anniversary. It was perfect! The room was beautiful and spotless with a gorgeous view of the waterfront and wharf. Check in was smooth and quick and the person working even wished us a happy anniversary. We arrived at the hotel at 12:30 p.m. and our room was ready! The complimentary bottle of wine was wonderful (Chilean). We also received a snack tray of cheeses, crackers, chocolates and fruit. I believe this was due to our anniversary. Nice touch! The bed was so comfortable and the linens were very high quality. Loved the bathrobes too. I usually don't use the toiletries provided by the hotel but these smelled so good, I couldn't resist. There were also fresh flowers in the huge bathroom and a live potted plant in the bed area. The person who handled our check in was very friendly and helpful and made us feel welcome immediately. He also arranged our dinner reservations. Another plus..... parking was free, easy and secure. The deluxe continental breakfast was lovely - fresh berries, melons and other fruits, bagels, cereal, pastries, hard-boiled eggs, juices, coffee, tea, etc. We had our breakfast in the beautiful courtyard. We will definitely stay at this inn again. It was very convenient.... just a short walk to the water taxi stop. We were also offered a complimentary limo service to our dinner destination but decided to walk. Can't say enough about this gorgeous, clean, friendly inn and I am very particular! I even liked the fact that there was no "hotel smell" at Henderson's. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: gailwNH
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a garden view room for 3 nights while we were in Baltimore to see a Red Sox game and get together with some old friends. The room was very nice, spotless, and comfortably furnished. More tv channels than anyone could want (but unfortunately you can't watch the baseball game on the room tv's, only on the tv in the lobby). The bed was the the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in in a hotel. Wonderful array of pillows, so we could find just what we wanted. Extra pillows were produced by the desk clerk with no problem. We were getting together for a reunion with old friends who were coming in from out of town to meet us at our hotel before going out to dinner. I asked if the hotel minded if we took the bottle of wine the hotel gave us to the lobby with some crackers and cheese to visit with our friends for an hour or so before dinner. They were exceedingly gracious, offered to supply us with more wine glasses should we need them, gave my friends parking passes to the hotel parking lot. The complimentary breakfasts were, again, among the nicest we've had in a hotel, with loads of fresh berries, yogurts, cereals, pastries, etc. Coffee was available 24 hours a day in the lobby. There is a very pleasant patio/courtyard where you could sit anytime, and take your breakfast if you want. Several fountains provided a soothing backdrop, pots of flowers on each table, and very nice landscaping. Lobby had very comfortable couches, quality panelling and art work, and soft lighting. The room was quiet, we never heard any other people or noise. Desk staff were fairly well informed (although one didn't know admittance to the Aquarium was by timed tickets and another didn't know why we couldn't get the Red Sox game on the room's tv) and uniformly pleasant and helpful. Housekeeping staff were excellent, pleasant, efficient. I give them a 10!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel last year!”
Reviews.Author: ILoveLongWeekends
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in NY and love to travel. We prefer long weekends every few months, to give you an idea of how many hotels we stay in per year, about 12 so far this year. We always try to book rooms based on feedback from TripAdvisor, and so far we have never been let down. This is a beautiful hotel, we always try to stay above 3 stars, and this is a definite 5 star! Gorgeous rooms, with a blend of antique inspired furnishings, the location was wonderful. Fells Point is a great artsy little area. I had a peaceful breakfast in the courtyard, and then took a stroll on the dock. We had a nice walk from downtown with our son after an Orioles game. And the complimentary bottle of wine in the room was a nice touch. I recommend this hotel to everyone that I know traveling to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Getaway in Baltimore!”
Reviews.Author: Wanderingchuck
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite weekend "getaways" involves getting in my car, leaving my home in New York, and heading down the I-95 corridor to Baltimore, Maryland. Just over two hours away, it's a whole different world!! What a place!! Baltimore is a totally revitalized city---a city where excitement and culture abound---where life is never dull---a place you can visit alone or with your family---and never be bored!! One of the most fascinating areas of Baltimore is Fells Point--a collection of brick row houses on the waterfront, dating back to the 1700's, originally built by sea captains. The cobblestone streets, gourmet restaurants, and interesting shops are a must-see. In the heart of this ecclectic enclave, Henderson's Wharf, at the end of Fell Street, will afford you a lodging experience of unsurpassed quality and comfort. Originally an abandoned tobacco warehouse dating back almost two centuries, this brick structure was lovingly and painstakingly restored----creating magnificent condominiums on the upper floors, and a first-rate hotel located on the ground floor. Your room affords a great water view, complete with boardwalk and boats, or, if you choose, quaint cobblestone Fell Street, or perhaps, the lovely courtyard in the center of the structure. Every luxury and ammenity awaits. Each room is equipped with fine furnishings, a magnificent bath, and all the conveniences one expects in a fine hotel. You can step out of the building, and stroll down to the heart of Fells Point in a matter of minutes--walk a bit further and be at the famous Inner Harbor. Great dining and entertainment are literally steps away!! The handy water-taxi will take you almost anywhere, and is really fun! Treat yourself to this wonderful and affordable getaway as soon as you can----you won't be sorry!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: gtimms
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our way to DC. I wished I could have stayed longer. Very nice staff. The hotel and the room were spotless! The room and hotel were furninshed in the best of everything. The bed was very comfortable. I did get a $10 better rate online then from calling the desk in person. Plan to stay there again when I come back to the area.

Reviews.Title: “the Inn is your best option”
Reviews.Author: Obrien13
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the Inn. Great location, great accomodations. Located in Fells Point, two blocks from water taxi and the bars and restaurants made it the perfect location. You're still close to everything but far enough away that it's quiet and relaxing. Rooms and bathrooms are large and clean. Had a wharf view looking at the sailboats. The continental breakfast is fantastic. Lots of fruit and many bagel and bread options. Also, hard boiled eggs, juices. Staff is extremely nice. Would stay there again in a second and would recommend the hotel to anyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !!!”
Reviews.Author: 3champ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Henderson's Wharf May 4-6 and were extremely pleased with our decision to stay here. Accomodations were wonderful and the staff was truly helpful on all aspects. Wonderful breakfast buffet selection of fresh fruits, cereals, pastries, muffins, eggs, juices, and coffee. Try John Stevens Ltd. ( 2 blocks away ) for dinner. Outstanding crab cakes, and pan seared Ahi Tuna. Top it off with their World Class Creme Brulee ( twice as big as anywhere else we have ever had it ) for $ 5.25. Beautiful nautical views surround Henderson's Wharf . Secured gate parking across the street at no charge was a welcomed bonus. Access to Water taxi is only a couple blocks over so really no need to even use your car for Inner Harbor access. Try Henderson's Wharf, you will love it !! We're counting the days until our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Henderson's Wharf!!”
Reviews.Author: flamingoqueende
Reviews.Content: Nothing but wonderful things to say about Henderson's Wharf! The staff and especially front desk manager, Ian, were so friendly and accomodating -- they made you feel right at home in this luxury property. Room accomodations are top quality (I want one of those mattresses!),we totally enjoyed sitting in the beautiful garden area eating our continental breakfast, and of course being on the water was a major treat! Within walking distance to great restaurants, pubs and shopping, we'd return to HW time and time again!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: mae1Virginia
Reviews.Content: What a nice place. From the time you walk in and check in its great. Our room was big. Nice little touches they do. From the bottle of wine they give you, to the continental breakfast. Really was nice. The breakfast had fresh fruit, water juices granola muffins bagels, crackers jams yogurt etc. Everything was done classy. Nice atmosphere. Worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Henderson's Wharf Inn”
Reviews.Author: linfer
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the reviews on Trip Advisor we booked Henderson's Wharf for our stay in Balitmore! It was so wonderful!! The room was beautiful, big and very clean. The bathroom was new and spacious. I thought that it was the best location on the inner harbor. Our back door was literally on the boardwalk . As far as I could tell, all the other hotels were across the street from the harbor in a busier area. Henderson's Wharf was a block from shopping, restaurants and pubs. I would stay here again in a minute and very much recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quiet and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: WldExplorer
Reviews.Content: This is a great Inn. The rooms are huge and comfortable. The mini bars have all sorts of goodies to enjoy with your free bottle of wine they offer you on check in. I loved the location because it was so quiet but within a short walking distance of pubs and restaurants at Fell's Point. I live and work in NYC and had a very difficult time leaving this inn.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: rajia21
Reviews.Content: We also loved this hotel. I think everyone has done a pretty good job of talking about the great points of this Inn - beautifully renovated rooms, great continental breakfast, choice of wine on check-in, and courteous staff. I'll just throw in a few things I haven't seen talked about much. We stayed in room 139. We paid for run of the house, so that's what we got. It was the first room by the reception, and we could see a bit of the marina, but we also saw a lot of people pass by. It was not loud, but it was slightly distracting. As stated by others, we also had our shutters closed 99% of the time. The room has an Ipod dock, which was nice. It also had a nice sitting area, and was quite large in general. The TV is DISH network satellite, so there are a ton of channels, including just about every movie channel under the sun (they start at channel 300). The description online says a "queen bed" but we most certainly had a king. It was comfortable to lounge in, but a bit soft for us, and by morning my husband had a sore back. Just made us get up a bit earlier and enjoy more of the day! The bathroom was very pretty. Not huge, but nice fixtures on the sink and fresh flowers. I wouldn't say this is a complaint, but it struck me as odd that they had done such a nice job of updating the bathroom, but didn't put in a better shower head. Pressure was okay, but I think a better shower head would have really upped the experience. Minor quip, I know. The area surrounding the hotel is full of bars. Some restaurants, but mostly taverns. There were some incredibly drunk people by 6 pm on Saturday wobbling through the area less than two blocks away. It wasn't a problem for us, but may be of some issue to someone else. There are also NO services within a 5-6 block range, so no running out to get a beverage or a razor if you forgot one without a pretty significant hike. In fact, when I asked the front desk where the closest "convenience store" was, she just kind of gave me a blank stare. FYI - there is a liquor store at the Broadway Market. There is also a 7-11 on Lombard street, but that's about a mile away. Taxi ride to Inner Harbor is between $6-$7 plus tip. Water taxi is $18 per day, unlimited, but it's not particularly fast. All in all, it really is a beautiful hotel. I would definitely stay here again. I'd just make sure to pick up my beer before checking in!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mich-noto
Reviews.Content: Henderson's Wharf Inn occupies the first floor of an old tobacco warehouse right on the harbor. It was rebuilt in 2003 after Hurricane Isabella flooded it. The furnishings are beautiful: extremely tasteful and so comfortable. We had a King Harborside room with floor to ceiling windows looking out over the wooden wharf and the boats in the harbor. There were shutters that closed for privacy. The staff was attentive, the continental breakfast was definitely not your normal, predictable food - it was delicious, the setting was beautiful, and it was a short walk up a brick (stone?) street to many bars, shops, and restaurants. I especially enjoyed this hotel because I'm not fond of the closed-in feeling I get in highrise hotels, no matter how lovely they may be. It was so delightful to just walk out the door at the end of the corridor and be on the wharf with the breeze (rain, wind, sun- had them all) and water and boats. It was really interesting to see an enormous storm blow through one afternoon also. We had rented a car and especially appreciated the free parking in the lot that was just steps away. My son lives in Baltimore and the staff even gave him a pass so he could use the parking lot, as opposed to trying to find on-street parking, when he came over pick us up and to have dinner with us one evening. That was remarkable. I've stayed in fine hotels around the world, and this is one of my favorites. I certainly will stay here again when I return to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Deserving of it's Best Hidden Gem award”
Reviews.Author: Traci_K
Reviews.Content: We wanted to get out of DC for a couple of days over a holiday weekend in January. We chose Baltimore because I've been wanting to go to the aquarium on the Inner Harbor. Henderson's Wharf Inn was offering a great weekend price, & it had gotten such rave reviews on tripadvisor that I figured it would be perfect. It did not disappoint. Everything was great. We arrived very early & since our room wasn't ready, the front desk staff checked our bags so that we could grab some lunch nearby & walk around for a bit. We told them that we knew we were very early & that they didn't need to rush to get our room ready. When we returned from lunch, we planned to sit in the common area & read, but they had our room ready early. The complimentary bottle of wine was very nice. The mini bar was very well stocked & prices were actually very reasonable (compared to normal minibar prices.) The breakfast options were great & everything seemed very fresh. There was fresh coffee & tea available all day everyday. The front desk staff were extremely helpful & friendly. We upgraded to a harbor view room, even though the harbor isn't particularly picturesque. It was still worth the extra $20, since we could open up our shutters & look out at the water. If you're on the street side, you'll have people walking right by your windows if you open your shutters. We never once heard any noise from the rooms on either side of us or from the hall. I can't say enough great things about this hotel. After staying here I definitely understand why it consistently gets voted as one of the Best Hidden Gems on tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: scuppernog
Reviews.Content: I Did some research of hotels prior to booking here. And decided on Henderson’s after reading such glowing reviews. It seemed that even the most expensive area hotels had a much higher percentage of mediocre or bad reviews, and Henderson’s had basically all positive experiences. Now, having stayed there, its my experience too. They offer tremendous value. And the location on the water, cant be beat either. That being said, even a hotel with so many positive reviews can get a bad or mediocre one from time to time, but the chances of having a good experience here, I would say is as close to a sure thing as possible. Remember, customers have to accept some responsibility in making sure their stay is a pleasant one, and that includes asking for what you want, be it the type of room you want, or the view you want, or what the accommodations are like, or ease of parking etc. The more informed you are, the less likely there are that things are not to your liking. Was the parking lot the most convenient, no, but its close, and FREE!!! If it were paved, it might be better, but, it’s a minor issue. Are they the fanciest rooms in the world, no…but neither are they $2500 a night! (Which I’ve done also). But they are terrific for the money, well furnished, nicely decorated, good attention to detail, and id say worth 50% to 75% more, and equal to rooms twice the price at the major hotel chains, ie; Hyatt, Sheraton, etc. One of the nicest things about these rooms, is, they are not standard, run of the mill, boring, cookie cutter hotel rooms. Ive stayed in lots and lots of those…and never ever….need to remember them for any reason. Even the more expensive hotel chain type rooms are basically the same as the cheap rooms, only a bit larger…big deal!!! The included continental breakfast is so far above what you would get at any other hotel in this area that its laughable. And, if you have a penchant for snacks or drink in the room, the well stocked mini bar and snack selection is one of the best ive seen…at any hotel! Granted, its for pay, but, its worth the convenience if you get the munchies late at night! The gratis bottle of wine is a nice touch. The fact that this small hotel makes you feel less of a stranger, and more of a guest, makes you want to come back again and again, and the front desk staff is pleasant, and courteous. So, all in all, on a scale of 1 to 10, id give them a 9.975! the only markdown for the gravel parking lot….but overall……..Bravo Henderson’s, Bravo!!!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you trip advisor!!!! :)”
Reviews.Author: Squashblossom79
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel, booked solely on pictures and others reviews on trip advisor...what a wonderful little place, located at the quieter end of the harbor. If you are looking for a place that is nice and quiet, maybe for a weekend getaway with plenty to do, then this is your place. The room was absolutely wonderful, from the lighting, to the view, to the complimentary bottle of wine, to the fresh orchids in the bathroom. Everything was clean and crisp, truly felt like "our" room. We booked a harborview room that was very unique, one of our walls was completely brick and that gave it the feel of a cobblestone inn. The windows opened up to a view of the harbor that was absolutely beautiful. The security is great too! Everyone coming in has to pass the front desk to gain access to any rooms and there is a secure gated parking lot. If you are looking for a great deal and a short drive to the Inner Harbor main attractions, this is definately the place!!

Reviews.Title: “The best of the inner harbor”
Reviews.Author: JOV_8
Reviews.Content: WONDERFUL!! Beginning with checkin, to the furnishings of the room, the bottle of wine, & the perfect breakfast for free!! Not one negative thing can be said of this perfect hotel. The room was as if we were staying at a wealthy friends home. Worth going to The Inner Harbor just to stay at the Wharf. JV from NJ

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jereth
Reviews.Content: All i can say is Wow! This hotel was amazing! The interior is beautiful, the room was fairly large, all the staff was very nice and talked to us multiple times, asked us about our activities we had told them we were going to do when we came back, took a picture for us, and even recommended a great place to order take out at 11:30 at night. You also get a free bottle of wine (it was a pretty decent one too, no sutter home here) when you check in, and can switch it out for another one (they have about 4-5 options of red, white and even a sparkling). The breakfast was much better then other B&Bs i've stayed at, with fresh fruit including blackberries, blueberries, and red raspberries (in January!). They also include the typical bagel, cereal, etc. There is always coffee and tea available for all patrons 24/7. The courtyard in the middle of the building looked like it would be great to eat breakfast in over the summer. Abit too cold in january though. The water taxi is about 250 yards away and that takes you right into inner harbor \ the aquarium, and in the spring and summer takes you down to ft mchenry. A taxi ride from inner harbor back to the hotel (water taxi closes at 6pm in the winter) cost us $7, which isnt bad at all. Oh and parking is FREE at the hotel, almost forgot to add that in. Overall i dont think i would stay anywhere else in baltimore ever again, it is well worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Best Inn on the Water!”
Reviews.Author: TheTrekkingPenguins
Reviews.Content: Located in the charming Fell's Point area of Baltimore and within walking distance of countless bars and restaurants, this inn is a must stay. Hurricane Isabel (2003) flooded the inn with 2 feet of water. This event lead to a complete renovation leaving the rooms filled with beautifully custom made furniture giving them an antique but comfortable feel. The same proximity to the Patapsco River, which caused so much damage in 2003, leaves the visitor with majestic views of the harbor. Guests checking in are welcomed with a complimentary bottle of wine, a fully stocked snack bar (not comp), robes, comfy bed and flat screen tv. Breakfasts shouldn't be missed as it offers a wide variety of fruits, breads, pastries and juices that are attended to constantly.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing surprise!!!”
Reviews.Author: atwnsw2
Reviews.Content: It is a cross between staying at home and a first class hotel. I can't recommend it enough and love both the neighborhood as well as the proximity to Johns Hopkins (which was the reason for our trip). In addition the property offers such amenities as free continental breakfast which is really more of a buffet style. All in all, first class property. Thanks Tripadvisor forum for pointing this out .....

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Good”
Reviews.Author: Frugal-Bear
Reviews.Content: Before reserving on the web, I corresponded with the hotel by e-mail, and received quick, complete, and courteous replies to my messages. The truthfulness of those replies was verified by our experience. All rooms are ground level (which makes access easy for people who cannot negotiate stairs), each with own heating and air conditioning and hot water supply. Ours was very spacious, well-furnished, clean, quiet, and smoke free. The front desk people were efficient, helpful, and responsive. Housekeeping was generally good, though the maid failed to replace used toiletries. The "continental" breakfast was excellent and plentiful; it included good pastries and bagels, a variety of excellent fresh fruit, yogurt, and hard boiled eggs. Free parking is available on an adjacent unpaved lot, which is accessed a bit inconveniently by room key. A free newspaper is provided even on Sunday. One computer with printer/copier/fax is available for guest use free. However, the computer is set to search Yahoo for entries on the address line that are not web addresses, with the result that Microsoft e-mail cannot be accessed by entering <email> or <webmail> on the address line. No chair or floor lamp in the room was suitable for reading. There were no grab bars in the bathroom, and the basin was unusually small.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED Henderson's Wharf Inn!”
Reviews.Author: NeedABreakInSC-PA
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fabulous stay at Henderson's Wharf Inn. Drive east beyond the National Aquarium to where the pavement suddenly turns to cobblestone. Travel these streets past beautiful homes and businesses reminiscent of early America to the water where you'll see the inn. Park in the free and gated parking adjacent to the inn and your stay at Henderson's begins. The room was tastefully decorated for what was once a cigar warehouse and it overlooks the harbor. The complimentary bottle of wine along with featherbeds, feather pillows and luxurious robes offer a warm welcome to any traveler. The staff is courteous and immensely helpful. Ask for a recommendation for dinner and they'll even call for a COMPLIMENTARY limo. Retire to a quiet evening with Sirius radio or watch digital television on the flat-screened TV. You'll awake to papers on your doorstep before you make your way to the continental breakfast. Adjacent to the lobby, a spectacular display of fresh fruits (pineapple, lopes, grapes, berries), cereals, hard-boiled eggs, croissants, bagels, breads, yogurts, cheeses and crackers, juices, coffees and teas is provided from 7-10 AM. You can choose to enjoy breakfast in the garden or lobby, or use a bamboo tray to carry your tasties as you return to your room. My husband and I would HIGHLY recommend a stay here. We hope to return soon and are delighted to share our experience with you. Our stay cost $149 (before taxes) -- very reasonable in our opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel i've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Gemma1977
Reviews.Content: Fabulous rooms with fantasticly stocked mini-bars of local produce. Huge comfy beds, large bathrooms and beautiful harbour views. Staff were outstandingly helpful in reccomending and booking restaurants and giving advice. Amazing buffet breakfasts that you can eat outside in the sunshine. Five mins walk to Fells Point or to the water taxis to get across the harbour. Really great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended for your Next Trip to the Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: nj_group_diving
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Inn at Henderson's Wharf over the Army-Navy Weekend. The Inn is located at the end of a dead end street overlooking the Inner Harbor. The rooms and hotel have excellent views of the Inner Harbor, plus you are in walking distance (or short Cab Ride ~ $5) of the Fells Point district. For those not familiar with Fells point, it is a beautiful area of Baltimore that still has cobble stone roads, one of a kind stores and excellent pubs. If you watched the famous TV show, Homicide: Life in the Streets in the 90's, this is where they filmed the show. A must hangout for those visiting the inner harbor. The hotel was very clean, neat and offered some very nice amenities: Complimentary Bottle of Wine in the Room, Direct TV with Wide Screen LCD TV, free wireless in the rooms and cleaning wipes at the desk for your monitor. The only reason I did not give it a 5 is that they do not have Valet Car Park, Room Service or Bell Boys. They do have free parking at a private lot right next door and do have complimentary breakfast. You shouldn't need Room Service as there are so many good restaurants in the near vicinity, but these amenities aren't offered. All in all, I will definitely be coming back here when I return to Baltimore. I've stayed at the Hyatt before and prefer the location of this hotel much better.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Inn!”
Reviews.Author: cassiopiea
Reviews.Content: The Wharf Inn is in a great location next to the water. The room was quiet and clean, with a touch of old Baltimore charm. I would highly recommend this hotel to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: CindyC77
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel while traveling to Baltimore with 2 children, ages 10 & 7, to attend two Yankee games at Camden Yards. We had a reservation at the Marriott next to Camden Yards as well and decided to stay at the Henderson. The hotel was charming, clean, had a wonderful view right on the dock, and had a great continental breakfast. We loved the big bathroom and bathrobes in our 2 queen harbor-view room. We didn't like the $392/night room rate (which was seriously inflated due to the ball games). The Marriott was even a bit higher. We opted for the Henderson Wharf Inn to be a little removed from the hustle and bustle of Inner Harbor, but in hindsight probably should have stayed at the Marriott in our case. Let me explain - for the Saturday night game we intended to take the water taxi back and forth and did so during the day. When we headed to the 7:05 game at 4:45 pm, the line was very long at the water taxi - several boats worth - so we took a regular taxi into the Inner Harbor and had to walk a ways to reach the stadium. The taxis didn't want to get too close and get caught in traffic. The water taxis normally run until 11:00 pm or 30 minutes after the last out. In the 7th inning - our 7 year old was getting tired, it was 10:00 pm - so we left, concerned that we had a long walk back to the water taxi pick-up area and didn't want to miss our ride back. I think it would have been much easier to just walk across the street to the Marriott. We also had tickets to the game the following Sunday afternoon - and could have slept in later to just walk across the street again for the next game. All that being said - we would definitely return to the Henderson Wharf Inn - but not in conjunction with a ballgame and water taxi transportation. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the place was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel That Does It Right”
Reviews.Author: MallardDrake
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Henderson's Wharf gets it. With only 38 rooms, there's plenty of attention to each guest. The rooms are appointed with quality furnishings and the staff made sure they remain clean without intruding. The bottle of wine received on check-in and the wonderful daily breakfasts are simple touches that add so much more to the experience. The location is away from the tourist spots on the inner harbor, but easily accessible with a 10 minute water taxi ride. Wonderful restaurants are within walking distance and, again, away from the traps in the inner harbor. I don't know what "star rating" this property has, but it equals some of the 4.5-5 star properties where I've had opportunities to stay. I was in Baltimore on business. Ordinarily, I'm itching to get back home. The Inn at Henderson's Wharf made me wish I had stayed one more night rather than catching the last flight out of town. Kudos to the staff and management of this property!

Reviews.Title: “And they have a nice dock too”
Reviews.Author: wkearney99
Reviews.Content: We put the in-laws up at Henderson for the night while we stayed on our boat at the marina in front of the hotel. The manager of the hotel even keeps a boat there. Although, the marina's own bathroom facilities could use a little work. The reviews here are spot-on, it's a great hotel all around. We'll definitely put guests up there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jjpavano
Reviews.Content: one night stay only but it was a great hotel/room. property is in historic fell's point (across from kevin bacon's "diner" apartment) sits right on the harbor-the room was 25 feet from the water. very clean and quiet rooms. great breakfast and bottle of wine included. pleasant/helpful staff. will stay there next trip to baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding - Wish We Could Have Stayed Longer!”
Reviews.Author: MemberCharlotte_NC
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one-night stay at Henderson's Wharf and I must say that this hotel has earned every positive review. The front desk staff was unbelievably friendly and helpful, the room was beautiful and well-appointed, and the bottle of wine was a great touch! I was somewhat apprehensive about having our toddler son with us (I didn't expect that the hotel would be very 'kid-friendly'), but I was very wrong. They accomodated (not to mention guaranteed) our request for a crib in the room without hesitation. The bed was so comfortable, and the water view was amazing! The continental breakfast was far and away better than what you will get at any chain hotel...all fresh fruits and pastries here. Lastly, the price was unbelievable compared to the other hotels along the Harbor. Let the other tourists pay top dollar for the national chains - this place has my future business! My only complaint (albeit extremely minor) was the parking. I was hoping for an enclosed garage, but they have a surface gravel lot right next to the water. Not a huge deal by any means, though.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel !!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Andy-Sharon
Reviews.Content: Excellent rooms friendly staff especially Ian and the young girl on reception , the most comfortable nights stay i have ever had on my travels worlwide , rooms clean , nice breakfast , if we ever return to Baltimore this will be our only choice .

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Great Location, Amazing Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: PhoebeZamboni
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while moving my son into Johns Hopkins. The hotel is not convenient to the campus (it's about a 15 minute drive). But I'm staying here again when I return for Parents Day in November beccause it was so beautiful and comfortable. .Best thing is the location -- it's right on the water, on a harbor, near good stores, good restaurants and what seems to be a terrific local music scene. I love to walk and I enjoyed exploring this neighborood on foot and walking along the water. There were plenty of other people walking at all hours. The room was very large (I had room 109 -- a corner room) and the bed was comfy. Enough lamps for reading. Bathroom was very large and very clean with plenty of towels and excellent hot water and excellent water pressure. Staff were very warm and friendly although some were more knowledgeable than othrs. Coffee always available in the lobby, and a computer in an alcove off the lobby for internet access. Parking is nearby and convenient, although half the time the gate wouldn't open for me and I had to seek help. All of the rooms are on the first floor so you need to close the blinds if you want privacy! Otherwise the many people strolling by can look right into your room. Taking an evening stroll, I was easily able to see one woman sitting in bed reading in her pajamas, and a couple who were snuggling. But if you shut the blinds, you lose the wonderful harbor views. There is a free breakfast buffet in the lobby which is incredible. I've never seen anything like it. An extraordinary amount of fresh fruit -- raspberries, strawbetrries, grapes, bananas, melon, pineapple -- plus pastries, bagels, cereal, bagels, yoghurt and cheese. And coffee. All constantly replenished. You can take a tray and bring what you want back to your room or you can sit at a table in a lovely courtyard. My only real gripe is that the fridge in my room was incredibly noisy and kept waking me up. (It turns out there was an "off" switch that I could have used.) . The air conditioner was also very noisy but I turned it off. Also, I asked for an early morning wake up call and was told it was taken care of but the phone never rang. But the room was so nice and the location so incredibly pleasant and the breakfast so outstanding that it is well worth staying here if you are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Fells Point Favorite”
Reviews.Author: BEREA BON VIVANT
Reviews.Content: Even though the impetus for our trip to Baltimore was the Linda Ronstadt concert at Pier Six Pavilion, we were glad that we followed the recommendation of Tripadvisor reviewers and stayed here rather than choosing someplace in the Inner Harbor. The distance from Fells Point was a bit of a hike but walkable and, of course, the nearby water taxi (at $8/day such an inexpensive way to enjoy the harbor) was very helpful in getting around on our second day devoted to seeing the sights. Bar-hopping's not our style, but we didn't find Fell's Point at all rowdy and certainly appreciated Kali's Court (on Thames), a gelato spot in the neighborhood, and a trio of champion terriers we met strolling by the water each afternoon. The Inn itself met or surpassed every expectation of comfort and style we'd formed from Tripadvisor reviews. We were pleased with our wharf view and not at all bothered by some light foot traffic. One shortcoming is that no benches were available outdoors, so that we could sit and gaze at the boats on the harbor. Next time we come we'll bring along some portable seating in the trunk of our car.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves #1 rating in tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: gato94
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a one night stay at the Henderson Wharf Inn and really enjoyed our experience. We had stayed a month before at the Hyatt in the Inner Harbor, and found that hotel servicable but the area crowded with little charm. The Henderson changed our minds about hotels in Baltimore and the city in general. The staff was friendly and knowledgable, the rooms were lovely, the breakfast was great - overall the experience had the personal service you expect at a 5 star hotel with the feeling of a small inn. The area around Fell's Point was also much more interesting than the inner harbor, and you can easily take the water taxi to all the inner harbor sightseeing attractions. The hotel also includes free parking. They let us keep our car in their secure lot for 5 hours after we had checked out, which was incredibly helpful. This must be "the cool" place to stay because we noticed a band on tour unloading their bags when we were leaving. We will defintiely stay here again next time we are in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “one word...PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: uniquegetaways
Reviews.Content: I think i had the best room in the house....or....is every room the best room in the house?? Honestly, I had the corner room, windows from all directions overlooking the harbor. Had my complimentary bottle of wine...and some wonderful seafood delivered to the hotel...this was just what I needed for a weekend away from work..kids...significant other! Quaint, intimate, luxurious (but not in a snobby, stuffy kinda way) his hotel is definately a DO! Stay here, by yourself or with someone special, you'll love it! : )

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: Milmom
Reviews.Content: My husband & I purchased tickets to a Yankee vs. Oriole's game back in January. We've always heard great things about Camden Yards & the the Inner Harbor, so we thought we'd take a break from Yankee stadium & check it out. Camden Yards was the best stadium we've ever been in. It's structurally beautiful, clean as a whistle & perfectly designed. Cal Ripken was being inducted that day in the Baseball Hall of Fame, so the fans were obviously supportive of their hometown hero. Now about the hotel......Loved it!!!! The building was beautiful inside & out. We had a Harbor View room, little pricey, but worth it. As other reviewers have mentioned people do walk past the windows, but we didn't find it intrusive at all. Not a big continental breakfast fan, but this was one of the best I've ever seen. We stayed 3 nights & the fruits & danish/breads/bagels varied each day. Fresh fruit, dried prunes, fresh dates, cottage cheese, apple cinnamon bread.....just a few choices. I don't drink coffee much, but it was very good. There's a great assortment of Tazo teas for you tea todler's. Ceramic mugs as well as styrofoam cups with lids are availble. Oh & coffee & teas are available 24/7. The staff was extremely helpful & pleasant. Go, trust me you'll enjoy. I didn't realize how many different sections there are in Baltimore. Between, the Harbor, Fells Point & all the other areas there are TONS of restaurants. You may want to do a little homework on the different neighborhoods & restaurants before you go. Bring comfy shoes. Cobblestone streets are not condusive to sandals or heels. We took the Duck Tour which is in the Inner Harbor. Very touristy & slightly cheesy, but fun & informative. These tours are availble in other City's like Miami for one. If you're not aware they are vehicles that were used by the US Army in WW2. They are amphibious which means they travel by land like a bus & then the Captain drives the duck right into the water. It was very informative. Take it your first day there. The Information Center was also one of the best I've ever seen. If staying at Henderson's (which is in Fells Point), you can walk or so I was told, my feet wouldn't allow it, take the Water Taxi which is $8 per day per adult or take a cab. Cabs are seven bucks & economically the better choice to get to the Inner Harbor. Unfortunately while we were in the City the Harbor was experiencing something called "Red Tide" which as I understand it is a bacterial organism which depletes the water of oxygen & the fish die in great numbers. There were alot of dead fish floating in the Harbor. In Fells Point we ate at Koopers,Red Star, Shuckers & Brick Oven Pizza. I would skip Schuckers, but take it from an italian don't miss BOP! In the Inner Harbor we ate at the Cheesecake factory, which is always good. Great shopping, Great food, Great Hotel, Great City = Great time!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Every Way!”
Reviews.Author: MotSC
Reviews.Content: My first time ever writing a review- this Inn deserves applause! We stayed here for one night while leaving from Baltimore on a cruise. This was one of the best visits I have ever experienced (if not the best!) at a hotel. We were welcomed by the staff and made to feel quite at home. The wine was a most appreciated touch along with cut orchids in the bathroom. Our room was most tastefully decorated- we loved the old brick on the walls and full sized windows with plantation shutters. We enjoyed relaxing with the large flat screen TV with Direct TV and many channels, music, etc. The bed was luxurious with super comfortable linens, pillows, and bedding. There were many good restaurants in Fells Point in close walking distance. The very nice desk clerk helped us to select the perfect one. The breakfast buffet was lovely with delicious coffee, wonderful fresh fruit (even beautiful raspberries), and a nice selection of muffins, breads, etc. We felt very safe and pampered during our stay. The 12 Noon check out time was helpful as well. I would come back to Baltimore just to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected and quite pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: pm73v
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Henderson's Wharf when I unexpectedly found myself in need of a night's stay in Baltimore. I could not have made a better choice. Thoroughly charming and well maintained, this Boutique hotel was a revalation for me. Ideally situated on the water , close to the fun of Fells Point but far enough away for a quiet night's sleep, HW offered a very comfortable stay at a surprisingly good price. The staff was extremely friendly and knowlegable and my stay came complete with a welcoming bottle of wine and a delicious continnental breakfast. Though my needs only required one night's stay, I would definitely target Henderson's Wharf for a return visit or recommend it to anyone I know traveling to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Don't hesitate - great hotel, location, everything”
Reviews.Author: amejo
Reviews.Content: We stay this past weekend at the Inn at Henderson's Wharf based on what we saw on Trip Advisor and everyone was right - this is a great hotel. Walking distance to Fell's Point, quiet, nicely decorated, and nice touches like the free bottle of wine upon check-in. And when I wanted to switch to a white, they did so and it was even chilled. The complimentary breakfast was very nice - no hot foods, but very very fresh fruit and other items. Sitting in the inner courtyard was nice too. Great hotel for couples!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cathcuomo
Reviews.Content: Henderson's Wharf is a fantastic place to stay. The views of the wharf are lovely, and the location was perfect for our four day trip. We had rented a car (the parking at the hotel is very convenient) and drove the first night to the Inner Harbor, although you can take a water taxi. The rest of the evenings we just stayed around the Fell's point area, where there are excellent restaurants and quite a few lively bars. The cobblestone streets and historic homes make the surrounding area very charming, and we were happy to have chosen something away from the hectic Inner Harbor. The room was lovely, and the breakfasts, though continental, were beautifully presented with a large selection of fruits, cereals, and breads. Without a doubt, we will return to this idyllic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked Henderson's Wharf Inn!”
Reviews.Author: lkeefe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Henderson's Wharf Inn over the past Father's Day weekend (June 2007) and we all LOVED it. The room was great - plenty of space for everyone - 2 parents and our 18 year old daughter. The beds were exceptionally comfortable. The hotel front desk staff is tremendous! We asked for suggestions on different eateries and sight-seeing options and each time our questions were handled with extremely courteous service. We were given walking maps and directions by car. I phoned for additional towels and received them in less than 5 minutes! We thought the continental breakfast was one of the best we've ever had. The fresh fruit choices were amazing (strawberries, blueberries, pineapple, grapes, melons, raspberries and the most flavorful blackberries I've ever tasted) not to mention cereals, granola, muffins, scones, bagels, hard boiled eggs, 4 kinds of juice, coffee, tea, and milk. The courtyard area was perfect for breakfast - see the duck family in the attached photos. The free parking lot was very convenient - located right beside the Inn. I would definitely recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: slsiege
Reviews.Content: This is something of an odd property, on the ground floor of a huge converted warehouse - the rest, I believe, are condominiums - right on the waterfront in Fell's Point. The location is nice, a short walk from the Broadway Market area and the water taxi. My room faced the inside courtyard garden rather than the water, but it was pleasant nonetheless, very nicely appointed with a desk, a flat-screen TV and an individual water heater (no worries about shower pressure). The continental breakfast included fresh fruit and a choice of coffees. A big plus was the free, fenced-in parking with in-out privilege. Two caveats: the water taxi, which is the main public transit to downtown, the Inner Harbor and Ft. McHenry, doesn't run in bad or windy weather, and the front desk doesn't always know to warn you. (They were otherwise wonderful, even allowing me to keep my car in the lot several hours after check-out.) And you have to drive over cobblestones to get there. Still, this is a nice alternative given the huge prices being asked by Inner Harbor hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly What I Expected”
Reviews.Author: bmonst
Reviews.Content: This place is as good as advertised. We so happy we decided to stay here instead of the Inner Harbour. Our bed was a queen but very comfortable. The bathroom was very nice. Water pressure could have been a little stronger. Several TV channels to choose from. Glad we got a courtyard view room. The duck family was very cute. Free Breakfast, Good Coffee, Free Parking and Nice Front Desk. Short walk to Fell's Point. Friendly people in every pub and shop we went into. The Frame Shop right down the street from the Inn had a nice selection of gifts. I suggest going to Max's for beer and Kooper's for burgers. Also liked the Waterfront Hotel and Shucker's. Best meal we had was at the Wine Market Cafe in South Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Why can't other hotels be as wonderful?”
Reviews.Author: TingWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: The management and/or owners invested a lot of time and effort in providing every thoughtful detail & amenity to ensure their guests' comfort. We booked a Thursday night on a last-minute whim and got the last remaining room. Their thoughfulness was evidenced in every action: from the way they welcomed us and checked us into an immaculate and elegant room although we arrived 3 hours prior to check-in; they provided a cot for our six year old daughter without being asked--I had merely mentioned her while making the reservations; the concierge personally escorted her to see "the duckies"--apparently the mother duck that resides in the English courtyard recently had babies. The room was spacious and stylishly appointed, making one feel instantly at ease. The bed is probably the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in away from home. Live plants and orchids add to the ambiance. The complementary continental breakfast featured a huge spread of succulent fruit bursting with flavor and juiciness. We will be staying there again if we can get reservations, the low cost combined with the high quality of this inn is making it an increasingly challenging endeavor.

Reviews.Title: “all around excellence”
Reviews.Author: chrstn
Reviews.Content: read the reviews and booked for our anniversary - a wonderful hotel in a great part of town. The room was immaculate, the front desk very helpful and the breakfast was quite nice and the weather allowed us to eat out in the garden area. We had a harbor view room - but next time will try a garden/courtyard view for a change - the hotel is right on the water and as other posters have expressed, people stroll along the waterfront w/h = right i/f/o your hotel window - - but it was no biggie. Fells Point area = a great couples getaway

Reviews.Title: “There Are Still Places Like This???”
Reviews.Author: fiddy7st
Reviews.Content: This inn is a rare find. I don't believe I ever had a better stay anywhere. This is one place where the ad photos look identical to the actual thing. Sure, the rooms are clean and the price is very reasonable; and you could probably find decor as nice in at least a few other hotels in the state. But the reason I plan on staying here every time I stay in Baltimore is the staff. Not many places can you go these days and find such a perfect mesh of professionalism and decency. And I can tell when folks are just being nice to get your money, this isn't the case. This staff is the epitome of good hospitality. Every inn should be a Henderson's.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Buster123
Reviews.Content: I have traveled and stayed in alot of hotels over the years but Henderson's Wharf was by far the most amazing place I have ever stayed in. We only stayed here for 3 nights but I wished it could have been longer. We had a Harbour View room (highly recommended) the room was huge! So spacious! Really clean, great decor, great mini bar. Everything about the hotel was amazing, the staff were so friendly and made an effort every morning to say hi and make conversation. The buffet breakfast was gorgeous, bagels, fresh fruit, cereal! The bed was so comfortable and the room looked right out onto the water. This is an amazing hotel to stay and I would definately go back and stay there again, in fact I think I may even go again this year! If you are going to Baltimore don't stay anywhere else.....!!!!! Also, the location of the hotel in Fell's Point is fantastic, quaint little area of Baltimore away from the hustle and bustle of the main area / city. Great pubs and restaurants nearby also.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Inn experience. A quiet, like home, atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Norhoc
Reviews.Content: Our week long experience at Henderson's Wharf Inn was wonderful. We were traveling with a handicapped child who was to receive treatment at John's Hopkins Hospital. The Inn's location was perfect for us with great access to our room and an easy, short drive to the hospital. The staff at the Inn was quite helpful and tried to lend us a hand whenever possible. Breakfast was always a delight. The Inn was a comfortable, quiet place to relax after our days at the hospital and we look forward to returning some time in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed, good service, value for the dollar!”
Reviews.Author: el_midnite
Reviews.Content: A recent visit in Baltimore took us to Henderson's Wharf Inn for a three-night stay. Overall, I would say the Inn provides a strong value for the dollar spent ratio. Solid service, nicely decorated spaces, and comfort. If you don't mind being in this part of Fell's Point (about a mile from Inner harbor/Downtown) then the Inn is a great lodging option. The Inn encompasses the 1st floor of the old wharf building. The rest of the structure has been rehabbed into private condos. Keep that in mind when choosing courtyard or harbor view. The building is surrounded by the wharf which will have pedestrians on it...right outside your harbor view windows. The room was nicely furnished and the bed was quite comfortable, if a bit high. The bathroom was fine, quality toiletries were provided. The rooms have the infamous Sat Tv's, which can be a bit daunting for the uninitiated. Lots of channel options, though. Our room was a bit plain, it could use some art or something on the bare walls. The art ourtside in the public areas is nice, except that one scary fish eating the other not so scary fish. One is supposed to get a comp bottle of wine, but ours was not in the room. A small error, especialy given we don't much like wine. A reasonably good breakfast is served each morning, and as stated, seating is a priority during winter months. Space is at a premium, the lobby is not cavernous, so finding a place ot eat can be difficult. The solution: take a tray back to your room. The staff was attentive and helpful. This is not a full-service hotel, the manpower is smaller but we were treated well and with professionalism. They did a fine job. Fell's Point is my favorite part of Baltimore and the Inn is at a great location way out at the end of Fell. Walking to the better areas of Fell's Point is easy, a cab downtown is $7-10 and simple to catch. For leisure travelers the Inn is superb. For those most interested in the Inner Harbor or downtown it is a bit farther afield than many other Baltimore hotels, but that said, the Inn is first-rate. Henderson's Wharf Inn is number one on these pages for a reason. I do believe that ranking is well deserved. I would not hesitate to stay at the Inn on my next visit to baltimore. Reserve early as the place is small, but if you're going to Baltimore, do consider Henderson's Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: FatherMckenzie
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here on business, the hotel was selected and booked for us. It was very comfortable and nice and met all my requirements for a wonderful hotel room. Our room was large with a big comfortable bed with lots of pillows and nice linens. It was clean. It had a thermostat. We also had a water view and a flat screen TV (that took a little tech intelligence to use). There was a refrigerator and a complimentary bottle of wine. The furniture was not standard hotel issue but very lovely and solid. I loved the desk overlooking the harbor. The bathroom was also large and very nice and inlcuded all the amenities (hairdryer, shampoo, etc.) Oh, and big soft comfortable bathrobes (if you want to take one they will charge you $125.00). The service was not overly attentive but it was servicable. I did struggle to get my bags in through the door. But I didn't mind that much, I hate that cloying overattentive service you get in some hotels. The only drawback was that we were there for just as short time. It was deinately a room I would have enjoyed rolling around in for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Baltimore was cold but I stayed warm at the wharf”
Reviews.Author: DR01
Reviews.Content: For the money, you can't find a nicer hotel. I encountered at least ten staff members in two days and each one was very pleasant and helpful. The room was cozy with a bit of charm. I liked the inside shutters on the windows. Nice touch. Breakfast was healthily not hardy. The gym needs a little TLC. There is room for improvement, but under $150 on the harbor, your not going to even come close to Henderson's. Make sure to stop by the Red Star a block over on Wolfe. It's a great little neighborhood bar with fantastic food.

Reviews.Title: “#1 for a reason!”
Reviews.Author: t15
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel on trip advisor, but had to call to see if they would allow 3 kids in our room. Not only did they say, "no problem," they also provided a very comfortable roll-away bed for no extra charge. Parking was included for free (outdoor in a secure lot next to the hotel), and a free bottle of Cabernet Savignon greeted us in our very large room. The hotel and room were very elegant in every detail. The staff was friendly and courteous. The view of the harbor from the room was nice (although not of the touristy part of the harbor - so no one was staring back into our room). The hotel is located 2 blocks from the fun old part of town with the many unique shops, restaurants, clubs, and cobblestone streets. The breakfast was great with an exceptional variety of fresh fruit. The workout facility was well equipped an uncrowded with an HD TV. The kids, my wife and I all loved our stay there. It's the only way to go in downtown, but book early - we lucked out and got the last room available when we called 2 days in advance (in the OFF season).

Reviews.Title: “Loved Henderson's Wharf Inn”
Reviews.Author: HappyNYCTraveler
Reviews.Content: I just spent two nights at Henderson's Wharf Inn. It was a wonderful experience. It is a beautiful place in a very nice neighborhood. My room was clean and spacious. The bed was very comfortable. There was free high-speed Internet access and a coffee maker in the room, and luxurious terry cloth robes. I had a view looking out at the harbor and water, and it was really lovely. All the rooms in the Inn are on the first floor so you have to keep your shutters closed if you want privacy, but the shutters are lovely and the room is such a nice inside space that you don't mind having the shutters closed. The staff is very nice, very knowledgeable and extremely helpful. They gave us an excellent recommendation for a place to have dinner. There is a free continental breakfast included in the room charge and the breakfast is excellent. There is fresh fruit, many different kinds of breads and muffins, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, granola, and several kinds of cereal. The only negative was that there was a slight stale smoke smell in my room, as if the previous occupant had been a smoker. However, it was not too bad and everything else was so great that I really didn't mind. This is the only place I will ever stay in Baltimore. I loved the Henderson's Wharf Inn and I recommend it wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “amazing place”
Reviews.Author: NYC_traveller123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wharf between Christmas and New Years. From the moment we arrived we felt at home at this amazing hotel. If you go to Baltimore you should absolutely stay here. Right by the water, close to cozy pubs and the rooms are suburb. They provide a free bottle of wine and the snacks in the rooms are wonderful. Everything you could imagine and more! The front desk staff are so helpful and friendly. We even enjoyed hanging out in the hotel lobby reading and drinking coffee. Don't stay anywhere else when visiting that area. I stay in hotels all around the world and this place is up there!! Maya Balos, NYC, New York.

Reviews.Title: “One Great 'little' Inn.”
Reviews.Author: PAeric
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in. Unopretentious yet beautifully simple in all respects. Rooms, excellent. Service, excellent. Location, excellent. The whole experience was great. In fact, we had spa appointments at the Intercontinental (could not get into the Fells Point spa we wanted) and we just amazed at how awful that place was compared to our little slice of heaven. And, also, staying in the Inner Harbor?? Try Fells Point instead. MUCH better restaurants and nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, romantic Inn”
Reviews.Author: cjs121
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hendersons Wharf Inn for two nights following our wedding in November. We couldn't have picked a better place! The Inn is gorgeous, the staff are incredibly friendly and helpful, and the continental breakfast is not to be beat. The bottle of wine was a nice touch, and the mini bar is well stocked for late-night snacks. I also loved that coffee and tea are available 'round-the-clock in the lobby. My only complaint: we had a ground-floor room facing out toward the harbor. There is a public sidewalk outside these rooms. When we arrived, we opened the shutters to enjoy the view -- only to find a man walking his dog staring back at us. So we kept the shutters closed throughout our stay. I wouldn't recommend harbor view rooms on the ground floor for this reason. That said, keeping the shutters closed certainly didn't ruin the stay. Stay here...you won't be disappointed! And be sure to tap into the staff's opinions on the local restaurants -- they won't steer you wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!!”
Reviews.Author: 80'sbaby
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend I and planned a weekend trip to the Henderson Wharf Inn and were not disappointed. For a hotel ranked 3 stars it was better than some of the 5 star hotels I've visited. The hotel rooms were immaculate, beds a little too soft but still very comfortable, and the bottle of wine was a nice touch. The mini bar was well stocked with snacks and drinks. Also if you needed some last minute gifts there were cute food items, all with a Baltimore theme, in there as well. The free parking lot was a plus, because parking in the city can be tricky and expensive! The hotel also offered us the opportunity to leave our car there after we had checked out, so we didn't have to worry about parking for the day. The continental breakfast was one of the best I've had. Bagels, pastries, fresh fruit, cereals, etc. You can eat at tables indoors or out depending on the weather, or you can take it back to you're room on trays. The location is walking distance to many nice shops and great places to eat. Although it was in the heart of the city, we had a very peaceful and enjoyable weekend. Since we live in the area we had done the Harbor many times so this was a nice change. If you are planning to visit the Harbor this hotel is short drive or water taxi away. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a nice getaway with a great location. Especially if you're local and want to feel like you're out of town this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wharf of an Inn”
Reviews.Author: nancyb19
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights to see a White Sox game. I had two teens with me and we all loved it. They let us check in early, we enjoyed the complimentary breakfast, the room - wow. I don't think i've ever stayed anyplace with 2 queen beds instead of 2 full beds. The bathroom had all the amenities and the staff was super helpful. Yes, i did enjoy my complimentary wine. The neighborhood around the inn was nice to walk through and the water taxi was easy to use. We loved the brick in our room and would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Weeeeeeeee
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my boyfriend at the end of September. Everything about the Inn was wonderful. Room was attractive and clean, staff was friendly and welcoming, and the location was fabulous. If you want to go out on the town, there is no need to drive.. bars & restaurants are one block away. ..and did I mention that the beds are outrageously comfortable?!Because they are. I highly recommend, and we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place pity about the reception staff”
Reviews.Author: personwales
Reviews.Content: This has a lovely location, atmosphere and rooms. However, the reception staff were not particularly helpful. The air conditioning in the rooms is incredibly noisy. We complained and the staff promised to get it looked at it the next day but didn't up date us and the problem didn't go away. We also asked the reception staff about something written in the hotel guide provided in the room and they didn't know it was there. The piece de la resistance was when we asked reception to book a taxi for us to Penn Station and they said we needed to allow 1.5 hours for what turned out to be a 10 minute taxi ride! They clearly know nothing about the area or the hotel but if you can manage without them and can stand noisy air con it's a lovely place.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, cozy and convienient”
Reviews.Author: nhnurse
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks traveling the mid-atlantic in September and by far the best place we stayed was the Henderson's Wharf Inn - we loved it! We were there for the Red Sox games. Used the water taxi around the inner harbor and "land taxi" after the games. The bed was comfortable and the room was cozy and we just can't say enough about it - it far exceeded our expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Where "Service" is not just in the Dictionary”
Reviews.Author: BestofTimes
Reviews.Content: We were guests at the hotel for two nights. The personnel was extremely helpful and most accommodating to all of our personal needs. (A rarity in today's world.) The hotel had an air of simple elegance, but extremely comfortable. The very large twin-bedded room overlooked the harbor and had a live -- not articificial -- Yucca tree in the bedroom and one twig of flowers in the bathroom. The breakfast buffet was not to be believed. There were different types of fresh berries as well as melons, grapes, etc. There were different cold and hot cerals, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, plus many other breakfast items. We enjoyed this wonderful breakfast sitting in the garden of the hotel. The hotel was immaculate and had a lot of nice personal touches. It is located in a quiet area facing the harbor. If you are looking for a fantastic place to have lunch or dinner, I strongly recommend the Black Olive, which is about a ten-minute walk from the hotel. The red snapper was the best ever, as was everything else, inclulding the service. The hotel and restaurant were a winning combination.

Reviews.Title: “The greatest secret”
Reviews.Author: Magellan4253
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to have one last big trip before the kids start to come along. We were in Baltimore for four nights following a few days in New York. The difference is immense. A short ($10) taxi ride from the train station led us to Fells point a part of Baltimore that time has forgotten, the quiet street that leads to the hotel is the street that Fells point has Forgotten. The quietness is deffening. on arrival we were struck by the natural beauty of the hotel, things got better when we were welcomed by the staff. You just new that nothing would be too much hassle for them. They reccommended and booked a great italian for us before we even got to the room. We booked an upgrade to a harbour view which was worth every pence (this is not a lot so worth it). The view was great, the room immaculate, hugh and well furnished. The beds are very soft which is my only (personal) downside. The Breakfast is a cold buffet that is of the highest standards to set you up for the day. There is some good shopping in Fells point and some great bars. if you want to go further the water taxi is a three minute walk away which for a one off fee ($5 i think) gives you unlimited trips around the various points of Baltimore harbour for a day. we used the hotel as a jump off base for day tripping to Washington DC purley because we heard things could get rough there at night. The trains are regular and cheap. if you want my advice stay at Hendersons wharf and go out to the sights and sounds of Baltimore and DC from there. if you are going to Baltimore for any reason this is the only place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A breath of fresh air”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was recently in Baltimore for a conference, and I wanted to stay somewhere other than the conference hotel. The conceirge of a large hotel in town actually recommended the Henderson's Wharf Inn to me. I couldn't have enjoyed my stay more...the rooms are inviting and stylish, the sheets were high quality (I'd guess > 500 thread count), and the pillows were fabulous. A free bottle of wine was also a welcoming touch. The hotel staff could not have been more hospitable and eager to be helpful. The breakfast was delicious, and the garden court in the middle of the inn provided a wonderful place to relax. Coffee and tea were always available to guests throughout the day in the lobby. When so many places just offer lip service to hospitality, where each perk is an extra charge, the Inn at Henderson's Wharf was a breath of fresh air. If I return to Baltimore, there is no doubt where I'll be staying.

Reviews.Title: “a little known gem”
Reviews.Author: gypsy41
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Baltimore yesterday. We were only there for one night for a business conference. The Inn is in Fell's Point which is about 2 miles from the main downtown area of Baltimore (aquarium/convention center/big hotels). It is in a quaint section on the Wharf with lots of pubs and restaurants, some cute shops within minutes of walking. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms were quite spacious and recently renovated, very clean and comfy. We had views right out over the marina. A welcome bottle of wine awaited us on check-in and they even brought me some milk in the evening on request ( complimentary). There is free high speed internet in the rooms and wireless access throughout the common areas. Our own ethernet cable was not working and within minutes they brought one to our door. And an excellent abundant continental breakfast awaited us in the morning which we enjoyed in the English courtyard garden. While I was in a business meeting all day, my husband was able to do work in the common area while enjoying the complimentary coffee bar. Free parking My friends stayed in downtown Baltimore and paid about $300, the Inn is under $200 and well worth it. Any other business meetings in Baltimore, I have no doubts I would stay here.

HotelInfo.Name: Henderson's Wharf Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 1000 Fell St, Baltimore, MD 21231
